After declaring that he possessed "ruthless aggression", Cena lost by a [[Pin (professional wrestling)|pinning]] combination.Hamilton, Ian. ''Wrestling's Sinking Ship'' (p. 67). After the match, Cena was congratulated by [[Billy Kidman]], [[Ron Simmons|Faarooq]], [[Rikishi (wrestler)|Rikishi]], and [[The Undertaker]].{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} Following the near-win, Cena became a [[Face (professional wrestling)|fan favorite]] and started [[Feud (professional wrestling)|feuding]] with [[Chris Jericho]], defeating Jericho at [[Vengeance (2002)|Vengeance]]. Then, Cena feuded with [[Los Guerreros]] ([[Chavo Guerrero Jr.|Chavo]] and [[Eddie Guerrero]]) and Cena picked up a victory over Chavo Guerrero on the September 3, 2002, taping of ''[[WWE Velocity|Velocity]]''.{{citation needed|date=February 2017}} On the September 12 episode of ''SmackDown'', Cena teamed with Edge in a losing effort against Los Guerreros, thus ending the feud in the process.{{citation needed|date=February 2017}} Cena went on to defeat the likes of [[Matt Bloom|Albert]] and [[D-Von Dudley]] as he was restricted to appearances on ''Velocity'' for the rest of September.{{citation needed|date=February 2017}} In October 2002, Cena and [[Billy Kidman]] took part in a [[tag team]] tournament to crown the first [[WWE Raw Tag Team Championship|WWE Tag Team Champions]] of the SmackDown [[WWE brand extension|brand]], losing in the first round.{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} The next week on ''SmackDown'', Cena [[Glossary of professional wrestling terms#Turn|turned on]] and attacked Kidman, blaming him for their loss, becoming a [[Heel (professional wrestling)|villain]] for the first and only time in his career. On the October 17 episode of ''SmackDown'', Cena defeated Kidman in a singles contest,{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} but was defeated by Kidman in a rematch on the October 24 episode of ''SmackDown''.{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} ====The Doctor of Thuganomics (2002–2005)==== Shortly after the Kidman attack on a [[Halloween]] themed episode of ''SmackDown'', Cena dressed as [[Vanilla Ice]] performing a [[freestyle rap]]. The following week on ''SmackDown'', Cena received a new character: a [[rapper]] who [[Promo (professional wrestling)|cut promos]] while rhyming. As the [[Gimmick (professional wrestling)|gimmick]] grew, Cena began adopting a variant of the 1980s WWF logo – dropping the "F" – as his "signature symbol", along with the slogan "[[Wiktionary:word#Interjection|Word]] Life".{{cite web|url=http://www.wweozshop.com/show_products.php?p_id=65|title=John Cena's variant of the 80s WWF logo|accessdate=May 9, 2007|publisher=WWEOzShop.com|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070513211628/http://www.wweozshop.com/show_products.php?p_id=65|archivedate=May 13, 2007|df=mdy-all}} At [[WWE Rebellion#2002|Rebellion]], Cena would team with [[Dawn Marie]] in a losing effort against Kidman and [[Torrie Wilson]] in a [[Professional wrestling tag team match types#Mixed tag team match|mixed tag team match]].{{cite web|url=http://www.thehistoryofwwe.com/02.htm|title=2002|work=The History of WWE|first=Graham|last=Cawthon|accessdate=May 24, 2015|date=October 26, 2002}}{{cite web|url=http://www.prowrestlinghistory.com/supercards/usa/wwf/rebel.html#2002|title=Rebellion 2002|date=October 26, 2002|accessdate=May 24, 2015|publisher=Pro Wrestling History}} Eventually, Cena was joined by an [[Enforcer (professional wrestling)|enforcer]], [[Barry Buchanan|Bull Buchanan]], who was rechristened B-2 (also written B² and pronounced "B-Squared").{{citation needed|date=February 2017}} B-2 helped Cena kick off 2003 in victorious fashion with a win over Rikishi on the January 2 episode of ''SmackDown'' and a win over Chavo Guerrero on the January 9 episode of ''SmackDown''.{{citation needed|date=February 2017}} Both Cena and B-2 participated in the [[Royal Rumble (2003)|2003 Royal Rumble]] [[Royal Rumble#Match|match]], but were unsuccessful.{{cite web|url=http://www.prowrestlinghistory.com/supercards/usa/wwf/rumble.html#2003|title=Royal Rumble Event Results|publisher=Pro Wrestling History|accessdate=February 8, 2017}} Cena and B-2 failed to capture the WWE Tag Team Championship from Los Guerreros, resulting in Cena replacing B-2 with [[Rodney Begnaud|Red Dogg]] until he was sent to the Raw brand in February 2003. For the first half of 2003, Cena sought the [[WWE Championship]] and chased the reigning champion [[Brock Lesnar]] after [[WrestleMania XIX]], gaining upset wins over Eddie Guerrero, The Undertaker and [[Chris Benoit]], who mocked him by wearing a "Toothless Aggression" shirt.{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} Cena won a number one contender's tournament for the right to face off against Lesnar for the WWE Championship at [[Backlash (2003)|Backlash]], but he failed to win the title at the event.{{cite web|url=http://www.prowrestlinghistory.com/supercards/usa/wwf/backlash.html#2003|title=Backlash 2003 results|accessdate=May 9, 2007|publisher=Pro Wrestling history}} After Backlash, Cena entered into a feud with [[Rhyno (wrestler)|Rhyno]] and Chris Benoit, which led to Cena, along with [[Chuck Palumbo]] and [[Johnny Stamboli]], defeating the team of [[Brian Kendrick|Spanky]], Rhyno and Benoit at [[Judgment Day (2003)|Judgment Day]].{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/judgmentday/history/judgmentday2003/results/|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20061026052317/http://www.wwe.com/shows/judgmentday/history/judgmentday2003/results/|deadurl=yes|archivedate=October 26, 2006|title=Judgment Day 2003 Results|publisher=[[WWE]]|accessdate=February 8, 2017|df=}} Shortly thereafter, Cena began mocking The Undertaker before and after his matches leading to a match between the two at [[Vengeance (2003)|Vengeance]], where he lost a [[Professional wrestling match types#Singles match|singles match]] against The Undertaker.{{cite web|last=Clevett|first=Jason|title=Angle takes Vengeance on Lesnar|url=http://www.canoe.com/Slam/Wrestling/2003/07/28/147709.html|work=SLAM! Sports: Wrestling|publisher=[[Canoe.ca|Canadian Online Explorer]]|date=July 28, 2003|accessdate=July 30, 2016|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160822072750/http://www.canoe.com/Slam/Wrestling/2003/07/28/147709.html|archivedate=August 22, 2016|df=mdy-all}} In a rematch between the two, Cena would once again defeat The Undertaker on the August 5 episode of ''SmackDown'', this time with assistance from [[Matt Bloom|A-Train]]. The feud between the two came to an end on the August 19 episode of ''SmackDown'', when Cena and A-Train defeated Undertaker and [[Orlando Jordan]] in a [[Professional wrestling tag team match types|tag team match]]. Cena then pursued the [[WWE United States Championship|United States Championship]], but lost to then champion Eddie Guerrero in a [[Parking Lot Brawl|Latino Street Fight]] for the title.{{cite web|last=Radican|first=Sean|title=9/11 WWE Smackdown review: Radican's detailed report on show|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/TV_Reports_9/article_5265.shtml#.WCYFwS2LTIU|work=Pro Wrestling Torch|date=September 11, 2003|accessdate=November 11, 2016}} [[File:John Cena as United States Champion.jpg|thumb|upright|Cena with his customized [[WWE United States Championship|United States Championship]] belt in January 2005]] After losing to Kurt Angle at [[No Mercy (2003)|No Mercy]],{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.com/Slam/Wrestling/2003/10/20/231323.html|title=No Mercy for WWE fans|last=Powell|first=John|date=October 20, 2003|publisher=Canoe: Slam Wrestling|accessdate=February 8, 2017}} Cena became a [[Face (professional wrestling)|fan favorite]] (of which he's remained since) when he joined Angle as a member of his team at [[Survivor Series (2003)|Survivor Series]], where Cena and Chris Benoit were the survivors.{{cite web|url=http://www.prowrestlinghistory.com/supercards/usa/wwf/survivor.html#2003|title=Survivor Series 2003 results|accessdate=December 29, 2007|publisher=Pro Wrestling history}} Despite feuding, Cena and Benoit would later join forces as a makeshift tag team and on the November 27 episode of ''SmackDown'' both won a [[Professional wrestling battle royal|20-man battle royal]] to earn a WWE Championship match when, after being the last two men remaining, they would eliminate each other at the same time and were both declared joint winners of the match.{{cite web|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/TV_Reports_9/article_6230.shtml#.WJrgmlWLSUk|title=11/27 WWE Smackdown Review: Radican's detailed report on show|last=Radican|first=Sean|date=November 28, 2003|publisher=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=February 8, 2017}} However, Benoit defeated Cena the following week on ''SmackDown'' to earn a WWE Championship match against Lesnar that same night.{{cite web|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/TV_Reports_9/article_6303.shtml#.WJrhWlWLSUk|title=12/4 WWE Smackdown review: Giebink's report on Benoit vs. Lesnar title match|last=Glebink|first=Dusty|date=December 5, 2003|publisher=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=February 8, 2017}} In early 2004, Cena participated in the Royal Rumble match at the [[Royal Rumble (2004)|Royal Rumble]], making it to the final six before being eliminated by [[Big Show]].{{cite web|url=http://www.prowrestlinghistory.com/supercards/usa/wwf/rumble.html#2004|title=Royal Rumble 2004 results|accessdate=May 10, 2007|publisher=Pro Wrestling History}} Chris Benoit was the eventual winner of the match.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/royalrumble/history/1988118/mainevent/ |title=Chris Benoit (spot No. 1) wins the Royal Rumble Match|accessdate=May 10, 2007|publisher=WWE|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090604030744/http://www.wwe.com/shows/royalrumble/history/1988118/mainevent/|archivedate=June 4, 2009|df=}} The Royal Rumble elimination led to a feud with Big Show.{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} At [[No Way Out (2004)|No Way Out]], Cena faced Big Show and Kurt Angle in a [[Professional wrestling match types#Basic non-elimination matches|triple threat match]] for a WWE Championship match at [[WrestleMania XX]], which Cena lost by [[Professional wrestling#Submission|submission]] to Angle.{{cite web|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/PPV_Reports_5/article_7183.shtml|title=2/15 WWE No Way Out PPV review: Sowers's "Alt Perspective" detailed rundown|last=Sowers|first=Kevin|date=February 16, 2004|publisher=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=February 8, 2017}} Cena won his first singles [[Professional wrestling championship|championship]] in WWE, the United States Championship from Big Show at WrestleMania XX. He held the title for four months with successful defenses against the likes of [[Rene Dupree]], [[Rob Van Dam]] and [[Booker T (wrestler)|Booker T]], until he was stripped of the title on the July 8 episode of ''SmackDown'' by Angle after he accidentally knocked him over, thus attacking an official.{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} Cena won the championship back defeating Booker T in a [[Professional wrestling match types#Series variations|best of five]] series that culminated at [[No Mercy (2004)|No Mercy]],{{cite web|url=http://www.prowrestlinghistory.com/supercards/usa/wwf/nomercy.html#2004|title=No Mercy 2004 results|accessdate=May 10, 2007|publisher=Pro Wrestling history}} only to [[Glossary of professional wrestling terms#Drop|drop]] it to the débuting [[Carly Colón|Carlito Caribbean Cool]] the following week on ''SmackDown''.{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} After the loss to Carlito, the duo began a feud, which resulted in Cena allegedly being stabbed in the [[kidney]] while at a Boston-area nightclub by Carlito's [[Enforcer (professional wrestling)|bodyguard]], [[Aaron Aguilera|Jesús]].{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} This [[Work (professional wrestling)|worked]] injury was used to keep Cena out of action for a month while Cena was filming ''[[The Marine]]''.{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} Immediately on his return in November, Cena won the United States Championship back from Carlito.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/inside/titlehistory/unitedstates/30445411131 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20050624010358/http://www.wwe.com/inside/titlehistory/unitedstates/30445411131 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=June 24, 2005 |title=John Cena's Second Reign as US Champion |accessdate=May 10, 2007 |publisher=WWE |df= }} Cena later successfully defended the championship against Jesus at [[Armageddon (2004)|Armageddon]] in a [[Hardcore wrestling|street fight]] match.{{cite web|url=http://www.prowrestlinghistory.com/supercards/usa/wwf/armageddon.html#2004|title=Armageddon 2004|publisher=Pro Wrestling History|accessdate=February 8, 2017}} Cena took part in the [[Royal Rumble (2005)|2005 Royal Rumble match]], making it to the final two along with [[Dave Bautista|Batista]] until both went over the top rope at the same time, ostensibly ending the match, which was restarted and won by Batista.{{cite news|title=2007 Wrestling Almanac & Book of Facts|work=Wrestling's Historical Cards|publisher=Kappa Publishing|year=2007|page=117}} The next month, Cena then participated in a [[WrestleMania 21#WWE Championship #1 Contender's Tournament|number one contender's tournament]] for the [[WWE Championship]] and made to the finals at [[No Way Out (2005)|No Way Out]], where he defeated Kurt Angle to earn a spot in the SmackDown brand's [[WrestleMania 21]] [[Glossary of professional wrestling terms#Main event|main event match]],{{cite web|url=http://www.prowrestlinghistory.com/supercards/usa/wwf/nowayout.html#2005|title=No Way Out 2005 results|accessdate=May 10, 2007|publisher=Pro Wrestling history}} beginning a feud with then WWE Champion [[John Layfield|John "Bradshaw" Layfield]] (JBL) and his [[Cabinet (professional wrestling)|Cabinet]] in the process. In the early stages of the feud, Cena lost the United States Championship to Cabinet member [[Orlando Jordan]] after JBL interfered and hit Cena with his title belt.{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} ==== WWE Champion (2005–2007) ==== Cena defeated JBL at WrestleMania to win the WWE Championship, giving Cena his first [[Professional wrestling championship#World championships|world championship]].{{cite web|url=http://www.prowrestlinghistory.com/supercards/usa/wwf/mania.html#21|title=WrestleMania 21 results|accessdate=May 10, 2007|publisher=Pro Wrestling history}} Cena then had a spinner WWE Championship belt made,{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} while JBL took the original [[Championship belt#Professional wrestling|title belt]] and claimed to still be WWE Champion,{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} until Cena reclaimed the original championship belt in an [["I Quit" match]] at [[Judgment Day (2005)|Judgment Day]].{{cite web|url=http://www.prowrestlinghistory.com/supercards/usa/wwf/judgement.html#2005|title=Judgment Day 2005 results|accessdate=May 10, 2007|publisher=Pro Wrestling history|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070507014206/http://www.prowrestlinghistory.com/supercards/usa/wwf/judgement.html |archivedate=May 7, 2007}} [[File:John Cena performs STF against Mark Henry.jpg|thumb|200px|Cena applying an ''[[Professional wrestling holds#STF|STF]]'' to [[Mark Henry]]. He began using the move in 2005.]] Cena was drafted to the Raw brand on June 6, 2005, taking his title with him and became the first wrestler selected in the annual [[2005 WWE draft lottery|draft lottery]].{{cite news|first=Ant|last=Evans|title=Power Slam|work=What's going down...|publisher=SW Publishing LTD|id=132|page=4}} Cena immediately entered a feud with [[Eric Bischoff]], after refusing to participate in the "war" against the [[Extreme Championship Wrestling]] (ECW) roster at [[One Night Stand (2005)|One Night Stand]].{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} At [[Vengeance (2005)|Vengeance]], Cena made his first successful title defense since coming to ''Raw'', defeating [[Christian (wrestler)|Christian]] and [[Chris Jericho]] in a triple threat match. With Bischoff vowing to make Cena's stint on Raw difficult, he hand picked Jericho to take Cena's championship from him.{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} During their feud, even though Cena was portrayed as the "[[Face (professional wrestling)|face]]" (hero) and Jericho as the "[[Heel (professional wrestling)|heel]]" (villain), a vocal section of live crowds, nonetheless, were cheering Jericho during their matches.{{cite web|url=http://www.oowrestling.com/recaps/ppv/20050821.shtml|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080609224649/http://www.oowrestling.com/recaps/ppv/20050821.shtml|deadurl=yes|archivedate=June 9, 2008|title=SummerSlam 2005 recap|accessdate=July 7, 2007|publisher=Online Onslaught|df=}} Crowds started to heavily boo Cena during his next feud with Kurt Angle,{{cite web|url=http://www.oowrestling.com/recaps/raw/20051024.shtml|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090730071549/http://www.oowrestling.com/recaps/raw/20051024.shtml|deadurl=yes|archivedate=July 30, 2009|title=RAW results – October 25, 2005|accessdate=June 10, 2007|publisher=Online Onslaught|last=Scaia|first=Rick|quote=Cena's in the ring marinating in a mixture of 75% squeals and 25% boos|df=}} who took over as Bischoff's hand-picked number-one contender after Cena defeated Jericho in a [[Professional wrestling match types#Loser Leaves Town match|You're Fired]] match on the August 22 ''Raw''.{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} Cena held on to the WWE Championship through his feud with Angle, losing to him by disqualification{{cite web|url=http://www.prowrestlinghistory.com/supercards/usa/wwf/unforgiven.html#2005|title=Unforgiven 2005 results|accessdate=May 10, 2007|publisher=Pro Wrestling history}} at [[Unforgiven (2005)|Unforgiven]], pinning [[Shawn Michaels]] in a triple threat match involving Angle at [[Taboo Tuesday (2005)|Taboo Tuesday]], and pinning Angle at [[Survivor Series (2005)|Survivor Series]].{{cite web|url=http://www.prowrestlinghistory.com/supercards/usa/wwf/survivor.html#2005|title=Survivor Series 2005 results|accessdate=May 10, 2007|publisher=Pro Wrestling history}} The feud with Angle also saw Cena add a secondary, submission based, [[Glossary of professional wrestling terms#Finisher|finishing maneuver]] – the ''STFU'' (a [[Professional wrestling holds#STS|stepover toehold sleeper]], though named for a [[Professional wrestling holds#STF|stepover toehold facelock]]) – when he was put into a [[Professional wrestling match types#Basic non-elimination matches|triple threat]] [[Professional wrestling match types#Submission|submissions only]] match on the November 28 episode of ''Raw''.{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} [[File:Edge vs. Cena.jpg|thumb|left|Cena facing off against [[Edge (wrestler)|Edge]] at a WWE [[house show]]]] At [[New Year's Revolution (2006)|New Year's Revolution]], Cena participated in the main event [[Elimination Chamber]] match where he retained the WWE Championship when he last eliminated Carlito. Immediately after a bloodied Cena won, [[Edge (wrestler)|Edge]] made his way to the ring to cash in his [[Money in the Bank ladder match|Money in the Bank]] contract – a "guaranteed title match against the WWE Champion at a time and place of the owner's choosing". Two quick [[Professional wrestling attacks#Spear|spears]] allowed Edge to pin Cena and win the championship.{{cite news|title=2007 Wrestling Almanac & Book of Facts|work=Wrestling's Historical Cards|publisher=Kappa Publishing|year=2007|page=119}} Three weeks later, Cena won the championship back at the [[Royal Rumble (2006)|Royal Rumble]]. After that, Cena began feuding with [[Triple H]], in which the crowd again started booing Cena and cheering the intended villain, Triple H, after being mostly cheered the last few months.{{cite web|url=http://www.oowrestling.com/recaps/raw/20060320.shtml |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090729015328/http://www.oowrestling.com/recaps/raw/20060320.shtml |dead-url=yes |archive-date=July 29, 2009 |last=Scaia |first=Rick |title=RAW results – March 20, 2006 |accessdate=July 10, 2007 |publisher=Online Onslaught |quote=For Cena's initial entrance, it's high pitched squeals, and the requisite 40–50% boos ... there were significant cheers for Trips, which is the REAL issue in play, here. |df= }}{{cite web|url=http://www.oowrestling.com/recaps/raw/20060403.shtml |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090730063854/http://www.oowrestling.com/recaps/raw/20060403.shtml |dead-url=yes |archive-date=July 30, 2009 |title=RAW results – April 2, 2006 |accessdate=July 10, 2007 |publisher=Online Onslaught |quote=What [Cena] hears is the same thing he heard last night: 10,000 lustily booing the hell out of him, and maybe 5,000 frantically cheering to try to match that volume level. |df= }} Cena beat Triple H at [[WrestleMania 22]] to retain the WWE Championship.{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} The negative reaction towards Cena intensified when facing [[Rob Van Dam]] at [[One Night Stand (2006)|One Night Stand]]. Taking place in front of a boisterous crowd of mostly original [[Extreme Championship Wrestling|ECW]] fans at the [[Hammerstein Ballroom]], Cena was met with raucous jeering and chants of "Fuck you, Cena", "You can't wrestle", and "Same old shit". When he began performing different moves into the match, the fans began chanting "You still suck". Cena lost the WWE Championship to Van Dam at One Night Stand after interference from Edge. [[File:Cena-2006.jpg|thumb|Cena addressing fans at a ''[[WWE Raw|Raw]]'' show]] In July, Edge won the championship from Van Dam in a triple threat match that also involved Cena, re-igniting the feud between him and Cena from earlier in the year.{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} After Edge went about retaining the title by dubious means—getting himself disqualified{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} (for which championships do not change hands) and using [[brass knuckles]]—he introduced his own version of Cena's "custom" title belt, this one with his logo placed on the spinner.{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} Cena eventually won the championship back in a match and arena of Edge's choice: a [[Tables, Ladders and Chairs match]] at [[Unforgiven (2006)|Unforgiven]] at the [[Air Canada Centre]] in Edge's hometown of [[Toronto]], Ontario, Canada after performing the ''FU'' on Edge through two tables off a ladder. The match had a stipulation that, had Cena lost, he would have left the Raw brand for SmackDown.{{cite web|url=http://prowrestlinghistory.com/supercards/usa/wwf/unforgiven.html#2006|title=Unforgiven 2006 results|accessdate=May 11, 2007|publisher=Pro Wrestling History}} Cena returned his version of the spinner title belt on the next night's ''Raw''.{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} On the heels of his feud with Edge, Cena was placed in an inter-brand [[Glossary of professional wrestling terms#Angle|angle]] to determine the "Champion of Champions" – or which was the most dominant champion in WWE's three brands. Cena, the [[World Heavyweight Championship (WWE)|World Heavyweight Champion]] [[Booker T (wrestler)|King Booker]], and the [[ECW World Heavyweight Championship|ECW World Champion]] [[Big Show]] engaged in a mini-feud leading to a triple threat match at [[Cyber Sunday (2006)|Cyber Sunday]], with the viewers voting on which of the three championships would be placed on the line.{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} At the same time, Cena became involved in a storyline with non-wrestler [[Kevin Federline]], when he began appearing on ''Raw'' with [[John Morrison (wrestler)|Johnny Nitro]] and [[Melina Perez|Melina]]. After getting into a [[Glossary of professional wrestling terms#Work|worked]] physical altercation with Federline on ''Raw'',{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} Federline appeared at Cyber Sunday to hit Cena with the World Heavyweight Championship during the match, helping King Booker retain his championship.{{cite news|title=2007 Wrestling Almanac & Book of Facts|work=Wrestling's Historical Cards|publisher=Kappa Publishing|year=2007|pages=121–122}} 2006 ended with Cena beginning a feud with the undefeated [[Umaga (wrestler)|Umaga]] over the WWE Championship,{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} while 2007 began with the end of his storyline with Kevin Federline. On the first ''Raw'' of the new year, Cena was pinned by Federline with an assist from Umaga, although later in the night he was able to get his hands on Federline performing an ''FU'' on him.{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} At the pay-per-view event, [[New Year's Revolution (2007)|New Year's Revolution]], Cena defeated Umaga to end his undefeated streak and retain the WWE Championship.{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/PPVReports/2007/01/08/3235732.html|title=Cena retains, Triple H injured at Revolution|first1=Dale|last1=Plummer|last2=Tylwalk|first2=Nick|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]|accessdate=December 31, 2007}}{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/newyearsrevolution/matches/3678150/results/|title=Champ ends the streak|first=Craig|last=Tello|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]|date=January 7, 2007|accessdate=December 31, 2007}} At the [[Royal Rumble (2007)|Royal Rumble]], Cena defeated Umaga in a [[Last Man Standing match]] to retain the title after Umaga was unable to get to his feet before the [[Referee (professional wrestling)|referee's]] ten count.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/royalrumble/history/2007/matches/3553510/results/|title=Cena: last man outstanding|first=Mike|last=McAvennie|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]|date=January 28, 2007|accessdate=December 31, 2007}} One night after the Royal Rumble, an impromptu team of Cena and Shawn Michaels defeated [[Rated-RKO]] (Edge and [[Randy Orton]]) for the [[World Tag Team Championship (WWE)|World Tag Team Championship]], making Cena a double champion.{{cite news|title=Pro Wrestling Illustrated, May 2007|work=Arena Reports|publisher=Kappa Publishing|date=May 2007|page=134}} At [[WrestleMania 23]], Cena defeated Michales to retain the WWE Championship after forcing him to submit to the [[Professional wrestling holds#STF|STFU]].{{cite news|author=McElvaney, Kevin|title=Pro Wrestling Illustrated, July 2007|work=WrestleMania 23|publisher=Kappa Publishing|date=June 2007|pages=74–101}} The next night on ''Raw'', Michaels turned on Cena, costing them the championship in the second of two 10-team battles royals, by throwing Cena over the top rope and eliminating the team. [[Hardy Boyz|The Hardys]] ([[Matt Hardy|Matt]] and [[Jeff Hardy|Jeff]]) eventually won the match and the championship.{{cite news|title=Pro Wrestling Illustrated, July 2007|work=Arena reports|date=June 2007|page=133|publisher=Kappa Publishing}} For the rest of the month, Cena feuded with Michaels, Orton, and Edge until [[The Great Khali]] declared his intentions to challenge for Cena's championship attacking and "laying out" all three of the top contenders{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} before assaulting Cena himself and stealing the physical title belt.{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} For the next two months, Cena feuded with Khali over the championship, eventually becoming the first person in WWE to defeat him by submission at [[Judgment Day (2007)|Judgment Day]]{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/judgmentday/history/2007/matches/4124402/results/|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080501164208/http://www.wwe.com/shows/judgmentday/history/2007/matches/4124402/results/|archivedate=May 1, 2008|title=Judgment Day 2007 Results: Goliath goes down|first=Louie|last=Dee|publisher=WWE|accessdate=July 6, 2007|date=May 20, 2007|quote=It was truly an impressive (and improbable) victory for the WWE Champion, magnified even more by the fact that he made Khali do something he'd never done before: tap out.}} and then by pinfall at [[One Night Stand (2007)|One Night Stand]].{{cite web|title=One Night Stand 2007 Results: Crafty Cena conquers, pins Great Khali|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/ecw/shows1/onenightstand/matches/4362508/results/|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070606082019/http://www.wwe.com/shows/ecw/shows1/onenightstand/matches/4362508/results/|archivedate=June 6, 2007 |first=Coret|last=Clayton|date=June 3, 2007|publisher=WWE|accessdate=July 6, 2007|quote=The Champ had beaten the never-pinned monster.}} Later that summer, Randy Orton was named the number one contender for the WWE Championship, starting a feud between the two.{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} Leading up to [[SummerSlam (2007)|SummerSlam]], Orton delivered a number of sneak-attacks, performing three ''[[Cutter (professional wrestling)#Jumping cutter|RKOs]]'' to Cena, who in the actual match retained the championship.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/summerslam07/matches/3900088/results/|title=SummerSlam 2007 Results|publisher=WWE|accessdate=August 26, 2007|date=August 26, 2007|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070829020754/http://www.wwe.com/shows/summerslam07/matches/3900088/results/|archivedate=August 29, 2007}} A rematch between the two occurred at [[Unforgiven (2007)|Unforgiven]], with Orton winning by disqualification after Cena ignored the referee's instructions and continued to beat on him in the corner.{{cite web|url=http://www.pwwew.net/ppv/wwf/september/2007.htm|title=Unforgiven 2007 Results|accessdate=September 17, 2007|publisher=PWWEW.net}} During a match with [[Ken Anderson (wrestler)|Mr. Kennedy]] on the October 1, 2007, episode of ''Raw'', Cena suffered a [[Glossary of professional wrestling terms#Legit|legitimate]] torn [[Pectoralis major muscle|pectoral muscle]] while executing a [[Professional wrestling throws#Hip toss|hip toss]].{{cite video|people=Dr. James Andrews|date=October 4, 2007|title=Exclusive footage: John Cena surgery|url=http://www.wwe.com/content/media/video/vms/raw/2007/october1-7/5581280|format=WMV|publisher=WWE|accessdate=October 4, 2007|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071011002542/http://www.wwe.com/content/media/video/vms/raw/2007/october1-7/5581280|archivedate=October 11, 2007}} Though finishing the match and taking part in the scripted attack by Orton after the match, surgery the following day found that his pectoralis major muscle was torn completely from the bone, estimating at the time to require seven months to a year of rehabilitation.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/raw/archive/10012007/articles/cenainjuryupdate|title=Cena out with pec tear, must surrender WWE title|first=Bryan|last=Robinson|accessdate=January 29, 2008|publisher=WWE}}{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/content/media/video/vms/raw/2007/october8-14/5609240|title=John Cena speaks out for the first time since his surgery|date=October 8, 2007|accessdate=October 29, 2007|publisher=WWE|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071028165642/http://www.wwe.com/content/media/video/vms/raw/2007/october8-14/5609240|archivedate=October 28, 2007}} As a result, Cena was stripped of the title by [[Vince McMahon|Mr. McMahon]] on the next night's episode of ''[[ECW (WWE)|ECW]]'',{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/nomercy/exclusives/cenamcmahonannounce|title=Mr. McMahon vacates Cena's WWE Championship|accessdate=October 3, 2007|date=October 2, 2007|publisher=WWE|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071011001846/http://www.wwe.com/shows/nomercy/exclusives/cenamcmahonannounce|archivedate=October 11, 2007}} ending what was the longest WWE Championship reign in over 19 years.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/inside/titlehistory/wwechampionship/|title=Inside WWE > Title History > WWE Championship|accessdate=October 2, 2007|publisher=WWE}} Cena's surgery was performed by orthopedic surgeon [[James Andrews (physician)|James Andrews]] at St. Vincent's Hospital in [[Birmingham, Alabama|Birmingham]], Alabama. Two weeks later in a video update on WWE.com, Dr. Andrews and Cena's physical trainer both said that he was several weeks ahead of where he was expected to be in his rehabilitation at that time.{{cite video|date=October 10, 2007|title=John Cena begins road to recovery |url=http://www.wwe.com/content/media/video/vms/none/2007/october15-21/5675400?zone=raw_index|medium=WMV|publisher=WWE|accessdate=October 24, 2007|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071026010751/http://www.wwe.com/content/media/video/vms/none/2007/october15-21/5675400?zone=raw_index|archivedate=October 26, 2007}} Despite his injury, Cena attended the annual WWE's ''[[Tribute to the Troops]]'' show filmed at Camp Speicher in [[Tikrit]], Iraq on December 7, and aired on December 24.{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} ==== World Heavyweight Champion (2008–2010) ==== [[File:John Cena August 2008.jpg|thumb|left|upright|Cena as one half of the [[World Tag Team Championship (WWE)|World Tag Team Champions]]]] Cena made a surprise return as the final participant of the [[Royal Rumble (2008)|Royal Rumble]] match, winning the match, and the traditional [[WrestleMania]] title shot, by last eliminating [[Triple H]].{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} Instead of waiting until WrestleMania, the title shot was cashed in against then WWE Champion Randy Orton at February's [[No Way Out (2008)|No Way Out]] pay-per-view{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} in a match where Cena won by disqualification, resulting in him not getting the championship.{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} The following night on ''Raw'', Cena was placed back into [[WrestleMania XXIV]]'s WWE Championship match by defeating Orton in a non-title match with Triple H as special guest referee, making it a triple threat match between the three men, during which he was pinned by Orton.{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} At [[Backlash (2008)|Backlash]], Cena failed to regain the title in a [[Professional wrestling match types#Basic elimination matches|fatal four-way elimination match]], in which he was eliminated by Orton.{{cite web|first=Dave|last=Hillhouse|url=http://slam.canoe.com/Slam/Wrestling/PPVReports/2008/04/28/5407546.html|title=HHH reigns again after Backlash|accessdate=June 23, 2008|date=April 28, 2008|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]|work=SLAM! Sports}} During that match, Cena eliminated JBL, renewing their feud from 2005. Cena defeated JBL at [[Judgment Day (2008)|Judgment Day]] and then at [[One Night Stand (2008)|One Night Stand]] in a [[Professional wrestling match types#First Blood match|First Blood match]].{{cite web|first=Bob|last=Kapur|work=Slam! Sports|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/PPVReports/2008/05/18/5609326.html|title=Judgment Day spoils streak of good shows|accessdate=May 1, 2009|date=May 18, 2008|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}}{{cite web|url=http://www.pwwew.net/ppv/wwf/june/2008-01.htm|title=WWE One Night Stand 2008|accessdate=June 23, 2008|publisher=PWWEW.net}} However, JBL defeated him in a New York City [[Professional wrestling match types#Parking Lot Brawl|Parking Lot Brawl]] at [[The Great American Bash (2008)|The Great American Bash]] in July to end the feud.{{cite news|url=http://slam.canoe.com/Slam/Wrestling/PPVReports/2008/07/20/6215361.html|title=The Great American Soap Opera|last=Hillhouse|first=Dave|date=July 20, 2008|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]|accessdate=July 14, 2009}} Cena also failed to regain the WWE Championship from Triple H at [[Night of Champions (2008)|Night of Champions]].{{cite web|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/PPV_Reports_5/article_26077.shtml|title=Keller's WWE Night Of The Champions PPV Report 6/29: Ongoing "virtual time" coverage of event|date=September 29, 2008|last=Keller|first=Wade|authorlink=Wade Keller|accessdate=September 28, 2013|publisher=Pro Wrestling Torch}} On the August 4 episode of ''Raw'', Cena became a [[World Tag Team Championship (WWE)|World Tag Team Champion]] for a second time, teaming with [[Dave Bautista|Batista]] to defeat [[Cody Rhodes]] and [[Ted DiBiase, Jr.|Ted DiBiase]],{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/raw/archive/08042008/|accessdate=August 5, 2008|date=August 5, 2008|last=Sitterson|first=Aubrey|title=Championship scramble|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]}} but failed to retain the championship the following week against the former champions.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/raw/results/|accessdate=August 12, 2008|date=August 11, 2008|last=Sitterson|first=Aubrey|title=Bracing for a SummerSlam|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080514184356/http://www.wwe.com/shows/raw/results/|archivedate=May 14, 2008}} Cena lost to Batista at [[SummerSlam (2008)|SummerSlam]].{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.com/Slam/Wrestling/PPVReports/2008/08/17/6484406.html|title=SummerSlam comes close to 'blockbuster' status|last=Plummer|first=Dale|author2=Nick Tylwalk|date=August 17, 2008|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]|accessdate=August 12, 2009}} Shortly after, Cena was named one of four contenders for [[CM Punk]]'s [[World Heavyweight Championship (WWE)|World Heavyweight Championship]] in the [[Professional wrestling match types#Championship Scramble|Championship Scramble]] match at [[Unforgiven (2008)|Unforgiven]], but he was replaced by [[Rey Mysterio]] after suffering a herniated disc in his neck, which required surgery.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/raw/results/|accessdate=August 25, 2008|date=May 28, 2008|last=Sitterson|first=Aubrey|title=Championship scramble|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080514184356/http://www.wwe.com/shows/raw/results/|archivedate=May 14, 2008}} Cena underwent successful surgery to repair the injury.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/inside/news/cenaoutvowstoreturn|accessdate=August 27, 2008|date=August 26, 2008|title=Cena out, vows to return|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]}}{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/inside/news/cenasurgeryinterview|accessdate=August 27, 2008|date=August 26, 2008|title=John Cena: Post-surgery interview|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]}} Cena made his in-ring return at the November's [[Survivor Series (2008)|Survivor Series]] pay-per-view event, defeating [[Chris Jericho]] to win his first World Heavyweight Championship.{{cite news|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/survivorseries/2008/matches/8464612|title=John Cena def. World Heavyweight Champion Chris Jericho|date=November 23, 2008|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]|accessdate=June 5, 2012}} The two continued their rivalry up to [[Armageddon (2008)|Armageddon]], where Cena retained his championship.{{cite news|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/armageddon/2008/8728776|title=World Heavyweight Champion John Cena def. Chris Jericho|date=December 14, 2008|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]|accessdate=June 5, 2012}} After defeating JBL at the [[Royal Rumble (2009)|Royal Rumble]], Cena lost the championship at [[No Way Out (2009)|No Way Out]] to [[Edge (wrestler)|Edge]], who attacked [[Kofi Kingston]] and took his place in the [[Elimination Chamber]] match.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/nowayout/2009/9229100|title=Edge wins World Heavyweight Title Elimination Chamber Match|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]|accessdate=June 5, 2012}} Cena received his rematch for the title at [[WrestleMania XXV]] in a triple threat match also involving [[Big Show]], which Cena won.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/wrestlemania/matches/9472972/results/|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5hby7JFXW?url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/wrestlemania/matches/9472972/results/|archivedate=June 18, 2009|accessdate=April 6, 2009|date=April 5, 2009|last=Passero|first=Mitch|title=Cena reclaims his gold|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]|deadurl=yes|df=mdy}} Cena lost the championship back to Edge in a [[Professional wrestling match types#Last Man Standing match|Last Man Standing match]] at [[Backlash (2009)|Backlash]] after interference from Big Show, who [[chokeslam]]med Cena through a big spotlight.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/backlash/currentepisode/9808960|accessdate=June 5, 2012|date=April 26, 2009|title=Edge def. John Cena in Last Man Standing Match (New World Heavyweight Champion)|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]}} This resulted in Cena beginning a feud with Big Show in which Cena defeated Big Show at [[Judgment Day (2009)|Judgment Day]]{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/judgmentday/2009/10109268|title=John Cena def. Big Show|date=May 17, 2009|accessdate=June 6, 2012|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]}} and at [[Extreme Rules (2009)|Extreme Rules]] in a [[Professional wrestling match types#Submission match|submission match]] by applying the ''STFU''.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/extremerules/history/2009/matches/10247542|title=John Cena def. Big Show (Submission Match)|date=June 7, 2009|accessdate=June 5, 2012|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]}} During Cena's feud with Big Show, [[The Miz]] challenged him to a match on the April 27 episode of ''Raw'', but as Cena was out due to injury, Miz claimed an unofficial win via forfeit and continued to do this over the following weeks, until Cena defeated him in a singles match at [[WWE The Bash|The Bash]].{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.com/Slam/Wrestling/2009/04/28/9271756.html|title=Raw: Batista next for the Orton Era|date=April 28, 2009|last=Plummer|first=Dale|accessdate=April 29, 2009|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canoe.ca|Canadian Online Explorer]]}} [[File:John Cena 2010.jpeg|thumb|upright|Cena as [[WWE Championship|WWE Champion]] in 2010]] At [[Night of Champions (2009)|Night of Champions]] in July, Cena challenged for the WWE Championship in a triple threat match against Triple H and defending champion Randy Orton (a rematch from [[WrestleMania XXIV]]), but was pinned by Orton after interference from Orton's protèges Cody Rhodes and Ted DiBiase.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/nightofchampions/2009/matches/10729722|title=WWE Champion Randy Orton def. Triple H & John Cena|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]|date=July 26, 2009|accessdate=October 21, 2011}} The next night, Cena won a [[Professional wrestling match types#Beat the Clock challenge match|beat the clock challenge]] to earn another shot at the WWE Championship at [[SummerSlam (2009)|SummerSlam]], where Orton would use several underhanded tactics to retain his title. A month later at [[WWE Breaking Point|Breaking Point]], Cena defeated Orton in an [["I Quit" match]] to win his fourth WWE Championship, but{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/wwebreakingpoint/2009/11401128|title=John Cena def. Randy Orton ("I Quit" Match – New WWE Champion)|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]|date=September 13, 2009|accessdate=June 5, 2012}} lost the title back to Orton in a [[Hell in a Cell]] match at the [[Hell in a Cell (2009)|eponymous event]].{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.com/Slam/Wrestling/PPVReports/2009/10/05/11300786.html|title=Title changes highlight Hell in a Cell|date=October 7, 2009|last=Sokol|first=Chris|author2=Sokol, Brian|accessdate=October 6, 2009|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} Three weeks later at [[Bragging Rights (2009)|Bragging Rights]], Cena defeated Orton in a 60-minute [[Iron Man match]] to regain the championship.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/wwebraggingrights/wwebraggingrightshistory/2009/exclusives/ironscorecard |title=One Hour, Anything Goes WWE Iron Man Match scorecard|last=Tello|first=Craig|date=October 25, 2009|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]|accessdate=October 21, 2011|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101011145252/http://www.wwe.com/shows/wwebraggingrights/wwebraggingrightshistory/2009/exclusives/ironscorecard|archivedate=October 11, 2010}} Cena successfully defended the title against both Triple H and [[Shawn Michaels]] in a triple threat match at [[Survivor Series (2009)|Survivor Series]], but lost it to [[Sheamus]] at [[TLC: Tables, Ladders & Chairs (2009)|TLC: Tables, Ladders & Chairs]] in a [[Professional wrestling match types#Tables match|tables match]]. The next night, Cena competed in a tournament to crown the [[Slammy Award#2009 Slammy Awards|2009 Superstar of the Year]], defeating CM Punk in the first round and Orton in the finals later that night to win the honor. He would get his rematch for the WWE Championship against Sheamus on the final ''Raw'' of 2009, where he won by disqualification, but did not win the championship.{{cite web|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/PPV_Reports_5/article_37357.shtml|title=Caldwell's WWE TLC PPV Report 12/13|last=Caldwell|first=James|date=December 13, 2009|publisher=PWTorch|accessdate=December 14, 2009}} While Cena regained the title at the [[Elimination Chamber (2010)|Elimination Chamber]] pay-per-view in an Elimination Chamber match, his reign was cut short after [[Vince McMahon|Mr. McMahon]] immediately made him defend the title against Batista, who won the title.{{cite web|first=Dale|last=Plummer|author2=Nick Tylwalk|url=http://slam.canoe.com/Slam/Wrestling/2010/02/22/12977706.html|title=Batista, Jericho and Michaels capitalize on Elimination Chamber opportunities|accessdate=February 22, 2010|date=February 22, 2010|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]|work=Slam! Sports}} Cena defeated Batista at [[WrestleMania XXVI]] for the title{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/raw/archive/02222010/|title=Taking the bull by the horns|first=Greg|last=Adkins|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]|date=February 22, 2010|accessdate=March 29, 2010}}{{cite web|url=http://wwe.sify.com/shows/articles/Results_Cena_uncorks_the_Champ_pain-237900|title=Results:Cena uncorks the "Champ pain"|first=Greg|last=Adkins|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]|date=March 28, 2010|accessdate=March 29, 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100401034622/http://wwe.sify.com/shows/articles/Results_Cena_uncorks_the_Champ_pain-237900|archivedate=April 1, 2010}} and successfully defended it at [[Extreme Rules (2010)|Extreme Rules]], in a Last Man Standing rematch.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/extremerules/currentepisode/14041538|title=WWE Champion John Cena def. Batista (Last Man Standing Match)|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]|accessdate=June 5, 2012|date=April 25, 2010}} Cena faced Batista one more time, winning an "I Quit" match at [[Over the Limit (2010)|Over the Limit]], thus ending their long-time feud.{{cite web|first=Matt|last=Bishop|url=http://slam.canoe.com/Slam/Wrestling/PPVReports/2010/05/23/14059136.html|title=Batista quits to end disappointing ''Over The Limit''|accessdate=May 26, 2010|date=May 23, 2010|publisher=Canadian Online Explorer|work=Slam! Sports}} ==== Storyline with The Nexus (2010–2011) ==== {{See also|The Nexus (professional wrestling)|l1=The Nexus}} [[File:Cena In Nexus.jpg|thumb|left|upright|Cena being forced to read a public address by [[Wade Barrett]] while a member of [[The Nexus (professional wrestling)|The Nexus]]]] On the June 7 episode of ''Raw'', Cena was suddenly thrust into a new storyline when during his main event match against [[CM Punk]], he was attacked by all eight former contestants of the [[WWE NXT (TV series)#Season 1|first season of ''NXT'']], with [[Wade Barrett]] as their leader. Punk, his follower [[Drew Hankinson|Luke Gallows]] and other personnel around the ring were attacked as well, but Cena took the worst of the attack and was carried out on a stretcher. This group later referred to itself as [[The Nexus (professional wrestling)|The Nexus]].{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2010/06/08/14303706.html|title=CANOE – SLAM! Sports – Wrestling – RAW: Vote early, vote often; NXT takes over|publisher=Slam.canoe.ca|accessdate=March 28, 2011}} At [[WWE Fatal 4-Way|Fatal 4-Way]], Cena lost the WWE Championship to Sheamus in a fatal four-way match involving [[Edge (wrestler)|Edge]] and [[Randy Orton]] after The Nexus interfered.{{cite web|url=http://weblogs.baltimoresun.com/sports/wrestling/blog/2010/06/fatal_fourway_thoughts.html#more|title=Fatal Fourway thoughts|date=June 21, 2010|last=Eck|first=Kevin|accessdate=June 21, 2010|work=[[The Baltimore Sun]]}} Cena lost to Sheamus in a [[Professional wrestling match types#Steel Cages|steel cage match]] at [[Money in the Bank (2010)|Money in the Bank]] after The Nexus again interfered.{{cite web|first=Greg|last=Adkins|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/moneyinthebank/currentepisode/14882700|title=WWE Champion Sheamus def. John Cena (Steel Cage Match)|accessdate=June 5, 2012|date=July 18, 2010|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]}} In retaliation to The Nexus, Cena formed an alliance with Edge, [[Chris Jericho]], [[John Morrison (wrestler)|John Morrison]], [[Ron Killings|R-Truth]], [[The Great Khali]] and [[Bret Hart]]. They defeated The Nexus at [[SummerSlam (2010)|SummerSlam]] with help from the returning [[Daniel Bryan]], a former member of Nexus, who replaced Khali after he was injured.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/summerslam/currentepisode/15092924|title=Team WWE def. The Nexus (Elimination Tag Team Match)|accessdate=June 5, 2012|date=August 15, 2010|publisher=[[WWE|World Wrestling Entertainment]]}} Hoping to end The Nexus, Cena challenged Wade Barrett to a match at [[Hell in a Cell (2010)|Hell in a Cell]] with the stipulations that if he were to lose, he would join The Nexus. After Barrett defeated Cena, he joined The Nexus,{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.com/Slam/Wrestling/2010/10/04/15570631.html|title=Hell in a Cell: Betrayal, fan interference, and flying shoes|date=October 4, 2010|last=Hillhouse|first=Dave|accessdate=October 4, 2010|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} and was forced by the [[Anonymous Raw General Manager|anonymous ''Raw'' general manager]] to follow their orders or be fired. Cena and fellow Nexus member [[David Otunga]] defeated [[Cody Rhodes]] and [[Drew McIntyre]] to win the [[WWE Raw Tag Team Championship|WWE Tag Team Championship]] at [[Bragging Rights (2010)|Bragging Rights]].{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/PPVReports/2010/10/25/15816946.html|title=Cena central to Bragging Rights; Smackdown wins again|last=Sokol|first=Bryan|date=October 25, 2010|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]|accessdate=October 26, 2010}} Later that night, he was forced to help Barrett defeat Orton in a WWE Championship match, giving Barrett the disqualification win, but not the title. The following night on ''Raw'', Cena and Otunga lost the WWE Tag Team Championship to fellow Nexus members [[Heath Slater]] and [[Justin Gabriel]], when Barrett ordered Otunga to lay down and lose the title.{{cite web|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwerawreport/article_44793.shtml|title=Caldwell's WWE Raw results 10/25|last=Wilkenfeld|first=Daniel|date=October 25, 2010|work=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=October 26, 2010}} At [[Survivor Series (2010)|Survivor Series]], Cena officiated a match for the WWE Championship between Wade Barrett and Randy Orton. Per stipulation, if Barrett didn't win the championship, Cena [[Loser Leaves Town match|would be "fired" from the WWE]]. Orton defeated Barrett to retain the title, thus terminating Cena's WWE contract ([[kayfabe]]).{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/PPVReports/2010/11/22/16256891.html|title=The fate of Cena is finally decided at so-so Survivor Series|last=Plummer|first=Dale|author2=Tylwalk, Nick|date=November 22, 2010|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]|accessdate=November 22, 2010}} The following night on ''Raw'', Cena gave a farewell speech, before costing Wade Barrett the WWE Championship by interfering in his rematch with Randy Orton.{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2010/11/22/16270746.html|title=RAW: The Miz cashes in as Nexus costs Orton WWE title|last=Plummer|first=Dale|date=November 22, 2010|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]|accessdate=November 23, 2010}} A week later, Cena invaded ''Raw'', first as a spectator, but then attacked members of Nexus, explaining that he would still take down Nexus one by one, despite not having a job in the WWE anymore.{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2010/12/07/16454056.html|title=RAW: Cena pushes Nexus, Barrett to the breaking point|date=December 7, 2010|last=Plummer|first=Dale|accessdate=December 7, 2010|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} On the December 13 episode of ''Raw'', Cena was rehired by Barrett in exchange that he would face him on December 19 at [[TLC: Tables, Ladders & Chairs (2010)|TLC: Tables, Ladders & Chairs]] in a [[Professional wrestling match types#Chairs match|chairs match]],{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.com/Slam/Wrestling/2010/12/13/16539736.html|title=RAW: The Slammy Awards falls flat|date=December 13, 2010|last=Plummer|first=Dale|accessdate=December 20, 2010|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} which Cena won.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/wwetlc/matches/16558816/results/|title=Results: Man of steel|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]|accessdate=December 19, 2010}} [[File:John Cena 2010.jpg|thumb|upright|Cena at ''[[WWE Tribute to the Troops|Tribute to the Troops]]'' in 2010]] On the December 27 episode of ''Raw'', The Nexus, minus Barrett, announced they were under new management and offered to bury the hatchet with Cena, to which he refused. The Nexus attacked Cena, leaving a Nexus armband in the ring during the process. As the group retreated, CM Punk, who had attacked Cena with a steel chair twice the week before, came to the ring to apparently attack Cena, but instead put on the armband left behind to symbolically announce his allegiance with The Nexus, becoming leader the following week by manipulating Barrett's banishment from the group.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/raw/archive/12272010|title=N-listing Punk|date=December 27, 2010|last=Adkins|first=Greg|accessdate=February 22, 2011|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]}}{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/raw/archive/01032011/|title=Steel resolve|date=January 3, 2011|last=Adkins|first=Greg|accessdate=February 22, 2011|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]}} On the January 17, 2011 episode of ''Raw'', Cena returned and faced Punk in a match, which ended in a [[Professional wrestling#No contest|no contest]] after Cena was attacked by the debuting [[Mason Ryan]], who later joined The Nexus.{{cite web|last=Caldwell|first=James|title=Caldwell's WWE Raw Results 1/17: Complete "virtual time" coverage of live Raw - Cena vs. Punk, Royal Rumble hype continues|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wweppvs/article_49726.shtml#.Vz66mTWLTIU|work=Pro Wrestling Torch|date=January 17, 2011|accessdate=June 20, 2016}} Cena competed in the [[Royal Rumble (2011)|2011 Royal Rumble]] match at the pay-per-view, which saw Cena eliminate most of the Nexus members, ending his feud with the [[Glossary of professional wrestling#Stable|stable]]. ==== Feud with The Rock (2011–2013) ==== [[File:Rock and Cena shake hands.jpg|thumb|left|Cena and [[Dwayne Johnson|The Rock]] agree to face each other at [[WrestleMania XXVIII]].]] During the same match at the Royal Rumble, Cena made it to the final five before being eliminated by then [[WWE Championship|WWE Champion]] [[The Miz]], who was not part of the match.{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.com/Slam/Wrestling/PPVReports/2011/01/31/17094896.html|title=Super-size Royal Rumble saves biggest surprise for last|date=January 31, 2011|last=Plummer|first=Dale|author2=Tylwalk, Nick|accessdate=April 3, 2011|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canoe.ca|Canadian Online Explorer]]}} Cena won the [[Elimination Chamber]] match at [[Elimination Chamber (2011)|the titular pay-per-view]] to face Miz at [[WrestleMania XXVII]] for the WWE Championship.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/raw/archive/01312011/|title=It's good to be "King"|date=January 31, 2011|last=Adkins|first=Greg|accessdate=February 22, 2011|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]}}{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/PPVReports/2011/02/20/17350351.html|title=Elimination Chamber mostly eliminates dramatic intrigue|date=February 20, 2011|last=Hillhouse|first=Dave|accessdate=February 21, 2011|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canoe.ca|Canadian Online Explorer]]}} On the February 21 episode of ''Raw'', Cena replied in rap form to comments made by [[Dwayne Johnson|The Rock]] the previous week, as The Rock returned as the announced guest host of WrestleMania. That night, Cena was placed into a [[WWE Raw Tag Team Championship|WWE Tag Team Championship]] match, with him teaming with [[The Miz]], where they defeated [[Justin Gabriel]] and [[Heath Slater]] to become WWE Tag Team Champions. However, their rematch clause was immediately invoked and they won the title back after The Miz attacked Cena.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/raw/results/|title=Intermitten reign|date=February 21, 2011|last=Adkins|first=Greg|accessdate=February 22, 2011|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110217081941/http://www.wwe.com/shows/raw/results/|archivedate=February 17, 2011}} After weeks of insults, Cena and Rock finally met, where, after a verbal confrontation, and brief attack by The Miz and [[Alex Riley]], Cena attacked The Rock with the ''Attitude Adjustment''.{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.com/Slam/Wrestling/2011/03/28/17788296.html|title=RAW: One last push toward Wrestlemania|last=Plummer|first=Dale|date=March 28, 2011|accessdate=April 4, 2011|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} At WrestleMania XXVII, Cena and Miz fought to a [[Professional wrestling#Countout|double countout]], but The Rock restarted the match and performed a ''Rock Bottom'' on Cena, allowing The Miz to retain the title.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/wrestlemania/27/miz-cena|title=Results: WWE Champion The Miz def. John Cena|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]|accessdate=April 5, 2011}} The next night on ''Raw'', Cena, in response to The Rock "screwing" him out of the title, agreed to face him in the main event of [[WrestleMania XXVIII]], making it the first match to be set up for WrestleMania one year in advance.{{cite web|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwerawreport/article_49042.shtml|title=Caldwell's WWE Raw results 4/4: Ongoing "virtual time" coverage of live Raw – The Rock & Austin live, fall-out from WrestleMania 27, Sin Cara debut|date=April 4, 2011|accessdate=April 8, 2011|last=Caldwell|first=James|work=Pro Wrestling Torch}} At [[Extreme Rules (2011)|Extreme Rules]], Cena defeated The Miz and [[John Morrison (wrestler)|John Morrison]] to become WWE Champion.{{cite web|last=Caldwell|first=James|title=Caldwell's WWE Extreme Rules PPV Results 5/1: Complete "virtual time" coverage of live PPV - three title changes and a host of gimmick matches|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wweppvs/article_49726.shtml#.Vz66mTWLTIU|work=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=May 20, 2016|date=May 1, 2011}} Cena went on to successfully defend the title against The Miz at [[Over the Limit (2011)|Over the Limit]] in an [["I Quit" match]]{{cite web|title=WWE Champion John Cena vs. The Miz & Alex Riley Handicap"I Quit" match|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/wweoverthelimit/2011/cena-miz-wwe-title|last=Wortman|first=James|accessdate=May 14, 2011|publisher=[[WWE]]}} and [[R-Truth]] at [[WWE Capitol Punishment|Capitol Punishment]].{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/capitolpunishment/2011/25019952|title=WWE Champion John Cena vs. R-Truth|accessdate=June 9, 2011|publisher=[[WWE]]|first=James|last=Wortman|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110610125238/http://www.wwe.com/shows/capitolpunishment/2011/25019952|archivedate=June 10, 2011}} Cena then began a feud with [[CM Punk]], who was leaving the company at [[Money in the Bank (2011)|Money in the Bank]], where he defeated Cena to win the WWE Championship, and left the company with the title.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/raw/2011-06-27/mcmahon-suspends-punk|title=WWE Chairman Vince McMahon suspends CM Punk|date=June 28, 2011|accessdate=June 28, 2011|publisher=[[WWE]]}}{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/raw/2011-07-04/results|title=Raw results: Stars and gripes|publisher=[[WWE]]|date=July 4, 2011|accessdate=July 5, 2011|author=James Wortman}}{{cite web|last=Tello|first=Craig|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/moneyinthebank/2011/cena-punk|title=CM Punk def. John Cena (New WWE Champion)|publisher=WWE|date=July 17, 2011|accessdate=September 4, 2011}} After [[Rey Mysterio]] won the WWE Championship in a tournament, Cena challenged and defeated him later that night to become WWE Champion for a record-breaking ninth time,{{cite news|author=James Coyle|url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,14203_7063250,00.html|title=Title glory for Cena|publisher=[[Sky Sports]]|date=July 26, 2011|accessdate=September 4, 2011}} only to be interrupted by CM Punk, who also claimed to be champion. Punk again defeated Cena at [[SummerSlam (2011)|SummerSlam]] in a [[championship unification]] match.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/summerslam/2011/cena-punk-wwe-title|title=John Cena vs. CM Punk – Undisputed WWE Championship Match|accessdate=August 1, 2011|publisher=[[WWE]]}} After [[Alberto Del Rio]] became WWE Champion by cashing in his [[Money in the Bank ladder match|Money in the Bank briefcase]], Cena became number one contender and beat Del Rio at [[Night of Champions (2011)|Night of Champions]] to win the WWE Championship for the tenth time.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/nightofchampions/2011/25031154|title=John Cena def. Alberto Del Rio (New WWE Champion)|last=Murphy|first=Ryan|accessdate=December 5, 2011|publisher=[[WWE]]|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/69vuAO84Q?url=http://www.wwe.com/|archivedate=August 15, 2012|df=mdy-all}} He lost it back to Del Rio at [[Hell in a Cell (2011)|Hell in a Cell]], in a triple threat [[Hell in a Cell]] match also involving CM Punk.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/hellinacell/2011/wwe-title-triple-threat-match|title=WWE Championship Triple Threat Hell in a Cell Match|accessdate=September 20, 2011|publisher=[[WWE]]}} Cena lost his rematch to Alberto Del Rio at [[Vengeance (2011)|Vengeance]] in a [[Professional wrestling match types#Last Man Standing match|Last Man Standing match]], due to interference by The Miz and R-Truth.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/vengeance/john-cena-vs-alberto-del-rio|title=WWE Championship Last Man Standing Match|publisher=WWE|accessdate=October 11, 2011}} After a few weeks of Miz and Truth attacking Cena and other employees, Cena was allowed to choose his partner to challenge Miz and Truth at [[Survivor Series (2011)|Survivor Series]] and Cena chose The Rock as his partner. Despite exchanging insults in the following weeks, they defeated Miz and Truth, though Rock closed the show by giving Cena a ''Rock Bottom''.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/survivorseries/2011/cena-rock-miz-truth|title=The Miz and R-Truth vs. John Cena and The Rock|publisher=[[WWE]]|accessdate=October 31, 2011}} [[File:The Rock vs John Cena.jpg|thumb|Cena and The Rock face off at WrestleMania XXVIII.]] [[File:Brock Lesnar and John Cena.jpg|thumb|left|[[Brock Lesnar]] faces off with Cena after his return in April 2012.]] Cena then began a feud with Kane,{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/raw/2011-12-19/results|title=RAW Results – December 19, 2011|publisher=[[WWE]]|accessdate=December 20, 2011}} who cited his disgust for Cena's "Rise Above Hate" slogan and claimed that Cena would need to embrace the hate in order to defeat The Rock at WrestleMania.{{cite web|last=Murphy|first=Ryan|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/raw/2011-12-26/results|title=WWE Raw SuperShow results: Kane rises to hate|publisher=WWE.com|date=December 26, 2011|accessdate=June 9, 2012}} Cena fought Kane to a [[Professional wrestling#Draw|draw]] at the [[Royal Rumble (2012)|Royal Rumble]],{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/royalrumble/2012/john-cena-kane|title=John Cena vs. Kane (Double Count-Out)|publisher=[[WWE]]|author=Mitch Passero|date=January 30, 2012|accessdate=January 30, 2012}} and then defeated him in an [[Professional wrestling match types#Ambulance match|Ambulance match]] at [[Elimination Chamber (2012)|Elimination Chamber]].{{cite web|last=Giannini|first=Alex|title=John Cena vs. Kane (Ambulance Match)|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/eliminationchamber/2012/cena-kane-ambulance-match|publisher=WWE|accessdate=February 13, 2012|date=February 6, 2012}} At [[WrestleMania XXVIII]], Cena faced The Rock in the main event match which had been building for a year and was billed as "once in a lifetime". The match ended when Cena attempted the ''People's Elbow'' on The Rock, and Rock countered with a ''Rock Bottom'' for the pinfall.{{cite web|last=Caldwell|first=James|title=Caldwell's WWE WrestleMania 28 PPV report 4/1|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wweppvs/article_59831.shtml|work=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=April 2, 2012}} The following night on ''Raw'', Cena accepted his loss and invited The Rock to the ring so that he could congratulate him. However, Cena's call was answered instead by the returning [[Brock Lesnar]], who then attacked Cena with an ''[[Facebuster#Fireman's carry facebuster|F-5]]''.{{cite web|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwerawreport/article_59908.shtml|title=Caldwell's WWE Raw results 4/2|last=Caldwell|first=James|date=April 2, 2012|accessdate=April 11, 2012|work=Pro Wrestling Torch}}{{cite web|last=Larnick|first=Eric|title=WWE Raw Recap: Brock Lesnar Returns, The Rock Wants World Title|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/eric-larnick/wwe-raw-recap-april-2-2012_b_1400156.html|publisher=The Huffington Post|accessdate=April 11, 2012|date=April 3, 2012}} This resulted in Cena feuding with the ''Raw'' general manager [[John Laurinaitis]], who revealed that he signed Lesnar to bring "legitimacy" to WWE and for Lesnar to become its "new face".{{cite web|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwerawreport/article_60192.shtml|title=Caldwell's WWE Raw Results 4/9|last=Caldwell|first=James|date=April 9, 2012|accessdate=April 11, 2012|work=Pro Wrestling Torch}}{{cite web|last=Caldwell|first=James|title=WWE News: Stipulation added to Cena-Lesnar Extreme Rules PPV main event (w/Analysis)|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/WWE_News_3/article_60434.shtml|work=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=April 21, 2012|date=April 16, 2012}} At [[Extreme Rules (2012)|Extreme Rules]], Cena defeated Lesnar in an [[Professional wrestling match types#Hardcore-based variations|Extreme Rules match]].{{cite web|last=Caldwell|first=James|title=Caldwell's WWE Extreme Rules PPV Report 4/29|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wweppvs/article_60881.shtml|work=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=April 30, 2012|date=April 29, 2012}} His feud with Laurinaitis escalated after [[Big Show]] cost Cena a match against him at [[Over the Limit (2012)|Over the Limit]],{{cite web|author=|url=http://www.midwestsportsfans.com/2012/05/wwe-over-the-limit-recap-john-laurinaitis-defeats-john-cena-in-main-event/|title=WWE Over the Limit Recap: John Laurinaitis Defeats John Cena In Main Event|publisher=Midwestsportsfans.com|date=May 21, 2012|accessdate=June 9, 2012}} but Laurinaitis was fired at [[No Way Out (2012)|No Way Out]] after Cena defeated Big Show in a match with both of their jobs on the line.{{cite web|url=http://www.prowrestling.net/artman/publish/WWE/article10025676.shtml|title=WWE News: Big stipulation added to the John Cena vs. Big Show main event for No Way Out|publisher=Prowrestling.net|date=June 12, 2012|accessdate=August 15, 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/nowayout/2012/no-way-out-2012-results|title=No Way Out 2012 results|work=WWE|accessdate=January 22, 2017}} Cena won the Money in the Bank ladder match at [[Money in the Bank (2012)|the eponymous pay-per-view]], earning a contract for a shot at the WWE Championship anytime within a year.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/moneyinthebank/2012/wwe-championship-money-in-the-bank-ladder-match|title=John Cena won the Money in the Bank Ladder Match for a WWE Championship Contract|publisher=[[WWE]]|accessdate=July 15, 2012}} At ''[[WWE Raw 1000|Raw 1000]]'', Cena cashed in his contract on CM Punk, and won the match by disqualification after Big Show interfered, becoming the first person to cash in a Money in the Bank contract and not win a title.{{cite web|last=Styles|first=Joey|title=Was CM Punk justified?|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/raw/2012-07-23/was-cm-punk-justified|publisher=[[WWE]]|date=July 23, 2012|accessdate=July 23, 2012}}{{cite web|last=Martin|first=Todd|title=Raw 1000th Episode Report|url=http://www.f4wonline.com/more/more-top-stories/3-news/26687-raw-1000th-episode-report-by-todd-martin|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120727223650/http://www.f4wonline.com/more/more-top-stories/3-news/26687-raw-1000th-episode-report-by-todd-martin|archivedate=July 27, 2012|publisher=[[Wrestling Observer]]|date=July 23, 2012|accessdate=July 23, 2012}}{{cite web|last=Herrera|first=Tom|title=Raw 1,000 results: John Cena failed to win the WWE Title; The Rock floored by CM Punk|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/raw/2012-07-23/raw-1000-results/page-10|publisher=[[WWE]]|date=July 23, 2012|accessdate=July 23, 2012}} Cena's feud with Punk continued into [[SummerSlam (2012)|SummerSlam]],{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/raw/2012-07-30/wwe-raw-results-26041396/page-9|title=Raw results: Raw General Manager AJ Lee gets the last laugh on WWE Champion CM Punk|publisher=[[WWE]]|accessdate=July 30, 2012}} where Punk defeated Cena and Big Show to retain the title,{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/summerslam|title=SummerSlam | Matches, Results, Videos, Photos, and More|publisher=WWE.com|accessdate=December 9, 2012}} and at [[Night of Champions (2012)|Night of Champions]], where they fought to a draw.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/nightofchampions/2012/john-cena-cm-punk-26048109|title=WWE Champion CM Punk vs. John Cena ended in a draw|publisher=[[WWE]]|accessdate=September 16, 2012}} After being sidelined with a legitimate arm injury,{{cite web|title=John Cena undergoes arm surgery|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/raw/2012-09-17/cena-undergoes-arm-surgery-26053092|publisher=[[WWE]]|date=September 18, 2012|accessdate=September 13, 2012}}{{cite web|last=Giannini|first=Alex|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/raw/2012-10-15/did-john-cena-pass-the-torch-to-ryback-on-raw-26060556|title=Did John Cena 'pass the torch' to Ryback on Raw?|publisher=WWE.com|date=October 16, 2012|accessdate=December 9, 2012}} Cena returned at [[Survivor Series (2012)|Survivor Series]] to be pinned by Punk in a match which also featured [[Ryback]].{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/survivorseries/2012/cm-punk-john-cena-ryback-26066289|title=WWE Championship Triple Threat Match|publisher=[[WWE]]|accessdate=November 5, 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121109012859/http://www.wwe.com/shows/survivorseries/2012/cm-punk-john-cena-ryback-26066289|archivedate=November 9, 2012}}{{cite web|last=Murphy|first=Ryan|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/survivorseries/2012/cm-punk-john-cena-ryback-2606628|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304073930/http://www.wwe.com/shows/survivorseries/2012/cm-punk-john-cena-ryback-2606628|dead-url=yes|archive-date=March 4, 2016|title=WWE Champion CM Punk def. John Cena (Ladder Match for the World Heavyweight Championship Money in the Bank contract)|last=Styles|first=Irfan Nasir|date=December 16, 2012|publisher=[[WWE]]|accessdate=December 16, 2012|quote=Dolph Ziggler def. [[Professional wrestling tag team match types#Mixed tag team match|mixed tag team match]] which ended in a disqualification after Cena was attacked by the debuting [[Big E (wrestler)|Big E Langston]].{{cite web|title=CALDWELL'S WWE RAW RESULTS 12/17|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwerawreport/article_67322.shtml}} Cena then defeated Ziggler on the January 7, 2013 episode of ''Raw'' in a singles match, and again in a steel cage match the following week, despite interference from AJ and Langston in both matches to end the feud.{{cite web|title=CALDWELL'S WWE RAW RESULTS 1/7|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwerawreport/article_67712.shtml}}{{cite web|title=CALDWELL'S WWE RAW RESULTS 1/14|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwerawreport/article_67856.shtml}} [[File:Cena FU Animated.gif|thumb|200px|Cena performs an ''[[Professional wrestling throws#Fireman's carry takeover|Attitude Adjustment]]'' on [[Kane (wrestler)|Kane]] in 2012.]] On January 27, 2013, Cena won his second [[Royal Rumble (2013)|Royal Rumble]] match,{{cite web |url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/royalrumble/2013/royal-rumble-match-26080784/page-5 |title=Full list of Royal Rumble Match participants and eliminations |publisher=[[WWE]] |date=January 28, 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6E3bwS0WP?url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/royalrumble/2013/royal-rumble-match-26080784/page-5 |archivedate=January 30, 2013 |accessdate=January 28, 2012 |deadurl=yes |df=mdy }} and later announced that he'd pursue the WWE Championship at [[WrestleMania 29]].{{cite web|title=CALDWELL'S WWE RAW RESULTS 1/28|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwerawreport/article_68224.shtml}} Cena, along with Ryback and [[Sheamus]],{{cite web|title=WWE Raw Report CALDWELL'S WWE RAW RESULTS 2/4|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwerawreport/article_68402.shtml}} began feuding with The Shield, which culminated in a [[Professional wrestling tag team match types#Mixed tag team match#Multiple man teamed matches|six-man tag team match]] at [[Elimination Chamber (2013)|Elimination Chamber]], where The Shield were victorious.{{cite web|title=CALDWELL'S WWE ELIMINATION CHAMBER PPV RESULTS 2/17|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wweppvs/article_68713.shtml}} On the February 25 episode of ''Raw'', Cena defeated CM Punk to reaffirm his status as number one contender for the Rock's WWE Championship.{{cite web|title=CALDWELL'S WWE RAW RESULTS 2/25|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwerawreport/article_68918.shtml}} He then returned to his rivalry with The Rock, with Cena blaming his personal and professional troubles on his loss to The Rock the previous year, going so far as admitting his own vanity had cost him the match.{{cite web|title=CALDWELL'S WWE RAW RESULTS 3/4|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwerawreport/article_69088.shtml}}{{cite web|title=CALDWELL'S WWE RAW RESULTS 3/25|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwerawreport/article_69509.shtml}} At [[WrestleMania 29]], Cena defeated Rock in their rematch to win his eleventh WWE Championship and shook hands with Rock as sign of respect.{{cite web|title=CALDWELL'S WWE WRESTLEMANIA 29 PPV RESULTS|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wweppvs/article_69830.shtml}} Cena then began a rivalry with Ryback,{{cite web|title=CALDWELL'S WWE RAW RESULTS 4/8|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwerawreport/article_69884.shtml}}{{cite web|title=Feud with The Rock, Ryback, and CM Punk|url=http://superbhub.com/biography/john-cena-net-worth-meme-age-theme-movies-wife-fact/}} during which Cena suffered a legitimate [[achilles tendon]] injury,{{cite web|title=WWE NEWS: Update – John Cena injured according to WWE|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/WWE_News_3/article_70269.shtml}} while also battling The Shield and facing them in losing efforts.{{cite web|title=CALDWELL'S WWE RAW RESULTS 4/29 (Hour 3)|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwerawreport/article_70289.shtml}}{{cite web|title=CALDWELL'S WWE RAW RESULTS 5/6 (Hour 3)|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwerawreport/article_70423.shtml}}{{cite web|title=CALDWELL'S WWE RAW RESULTS 5/13 (Hour 2)|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwerawreport/article_70569.shtml}} Cena retained his championship against Ryback in a Last Man Standing match at [[Extreme Rules (2013)|Extreme Rules]] as the match ended in a no contest aftet both men were down for a 10 count.{{cite web|title=CALDWELL'S WWE EXTREME RULES PPV RESULTS 5/19 (Hour 3)|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wweppvs/article_70699.shtml}} Cena then defeated Ryback in a [[Professional wrestling match types#Three Stages of Hell match|Three Stages of Hell match]] at [[Payback (2013)|Payback]].{{cite web|title=CALDWELL'S WWE PAYBACK PPV RESULTS 6/16 (Hour 3)|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wweppvs/article_71318.shtml}}{{cite web|last=Trionfo|first=Richard|title=WWE RAW REPORT: TOO McMANY McMAHONS?; WHAT HAPPENS WHEN YOU ARE NO LONG A HEYMAN 'CLIENT'; MARK HENRY GIVES AN EMOTIONAL SPEECH; A SCARE FOR DANIEL BRYAN; IS 20, 2013|publisher=PWInsider}} He defeated [[Mark Henry]] via submission at [[Money in the Bank (2013)|Money in the Bank]].{{cite web|title=CALDWELL'S WWE MITB PPV RESULTS 7/14 (Hour 3): Ongoing "virtual-time" coverage of live PPV – Cena vs. Henry, MITB All-Stars|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wweppvs/article_71944.shtml}} At [[SummerSlam (2013)|SummerSlam]], Cena lost the WWE Championship to [[Daniel Bryan]], with [[Triple H]] as the [[Referee (professional wrestling)#Special referee|special guest referee]] ending his reign at 133 days.{{cite web|title=CALDWELL'S WWE SSLAM PPV RESULTS 8/18 (Hour 3): Cena vs. Bryan WWE Title main event, did Orton cash in?|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wweppvs/article_72779.shtml}} The following night on ''Raw'', Cena announced that he would undergo surgery for a triceps tear and would be out for four to six months.{{cite web|title=RAW NEWS: Cena gone 4–6 months, Triple H explanation, WWE Title & World Title pictures, RVD, new tag team, more|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/WWE_News_3/article_72813.shtml|work=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=August 20, 2013}} ==== Record Breaking WWE Champion (2013–2015) ==== Cena returned at the [[Hell in a Cell (2013)|Hell in a Cell]] pay-per-view and defeated [[Alberto Del Rio]] to win his third World Heavyweight Championship.{{cite web|title=CALDWELL'S WWE HIAC PPV RESULTS (Hour 2): Cena returns in World Title match, Punk vs. Ryback HIAC match|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wweppvs/article_74179.shtml}} Cena successfully defended his championship against [[Damien Sandow]] on the October 28 episode of ''Raw'',{{cite web|title=CALDWELL'S WWE RAW RESULTS 10/28 (Hour 1): Cena opens Raw, Sandow attempts MITB cash-in, Shield|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwerawreport/article_74218.shtml}} and Alberto Del Rio in a rematch at [[Survivor Series (2013)|Survivor Series]].{{cite web|title=World Heavyweight Champion John Cena def.
