Alberto Del Rio|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/survivorseries/2013/world-heavyweight-champion-john-cena-vs-alberto-del-rio-26162290}} Next, Cena challenged then [[WWE World Championship|WWE Champion]] [[Randy Orton]] to unify their respective championships, with [[The Authority (professional wrestling)|The Authority]] agreeing and arranging for a Tables, Ladders and Chairs title unification match at the [[TLC: Tables, Ladders & Chairs (2013)|TLC: Tables, Ladders & Chairs]] pay-per-view, which Cena lost.{{cite web|last=Clapp|first=John|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/wwetlc/2013/john-cena-randy-orton-26166358|title=World Heavyweight Champion John Cena vs. WWE Champion Randy Orton (Tables, Ladders & Chairs Match)|publisher=[[WWE]]|date=November 25, 2013|accessdate=December 3, 2013}} A rematch occurred at the [[Royal Rumble (2014)|Royal Rumble]] for the now unified [[WWE World Championship|WWE World Heavyweight Championship]], where Cena lost after being distracted by [[The Wyatt Family]].{{cite web|title=WWE World Heavyweight Champion Randy Orton def. John Cena|author=Anthony Benigno|publisher=[[WWE]]|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/royalrumble/2014/john-cena-randy-orton-wwe-world-heavyweight-championship-26173053/page-3|accessdate=January 22, 2017}} The Wyatts continued to interfere in Cena's matches,{{cite web|title=Raw highlights: Jan. 27, 2014 – Daniel Bryan, Sheamus and John Cena vs. The Shield – Elimination Chamber Qualifying Match: Raw, Jan. 27, 2014|url=http://www.wwe.com/videos/playlists/raw-january-27-2014-highlights}} and at [[Elimination Chamber (2014)|Elimination Chamber]], caused Cena's elimination in the Elimination Chamber match.{{cite web|title=WWE World Heavyweight Championship Elimination Chamber Match BY John Clapp - wwe.com|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/eliminationchamber/2014/wwe-world-heavyweight-title-elimination-chamber-26178366}} {{quote box|width=30%|align=right|quote=I know how John Cena feuds tend to work. He loses one match, then wins the next two or three. Look at [[Alexander Rusev|Rusev]] and [[Bray Wyatt]] as examples. These feuds don't really help talent. They're established... as definitively below Cena. This is a running theme in WWE booking. [[Kevin Owens|Owens]] is... worse off than he would have been if he had never had the second and third matches with Cena.|source= — ''Pro Wrestling Dot Net'' analyst Will Pruett in July 2015{{cite web|last=Pruett|first=Will|title=Pruett's Pause: WWE Battleground 2015|url=http://www.prowrestling.net/article.php?43214|work=Pro Wrestling Dot Net|accessdate=21 July 2015}}}} After Elimination Chamber, [[Bray Wyatt]] accepted Cena's challenge for a WrestleMania match,{{cite web|last=Caldwell|first=James|title=Caldwell's WWE Raw results 3/10: Complete "virtual-time" coverage of live Raw – Bryan "hi-jacks" Raw, Taker & Hogan back on TV, Cena vs. Wyatts feud continues|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwerawreport/article_76923.shtml|work=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=April 3, 2014}} Wyatt wanted to prove that Cena's heroic act was a facade characteristic of "this era of lies" while further wanting to turn Cena into a "monster".{{cite web|title=John Cena vs. Bray Wyatt|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/wrestlemania/30/john-cena-bray-wyatt-26191422|publisher=[[WWE]]|accessdate=April 3, 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140314144145/http://www.wwe.com/shows/wrestlemania/30/john-cena-bray-wyatt-26191422|archivedate=March 14, 2014}}{{cite web|last=Guillot|first=Gene|title=John Cena vs. Bray Wyatt centers on Cena's legacy|url=http://www.nola.com/festivals/index.ssf/2014/04/john_cena_vs_bray_wyatt_center.html|publisher=The Times-Picayune|accessdate=April 5, 2014}} At [[WrestleMania XXX]], Cena overcame interference from [[Luke Harper]] and [[Erick Rowan]] to defeat Wyatt.{{cite web|last=Caldwell|first=James|title=WrestleMania 30 PPV results (Hour 2): Complete "virtual-time" coverage of Cena vs. Bray, big moment for Cesaro in the Andre Battle Royal, Shield vs. Outlaws|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/PPV_Reports_5/article_77520.shtml|work=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=April 10, 2014}} The feud continued after WrestleMania based on the story that Wyatt was capturing Cena's fanbase, which was exemplified by Wyatt leading a children's choir to the ring on the April 28 episode of ''Raw'', with the children later putting on sheep masks.{{cite web|last=Caldwell|first=James|title=Caldwell's WWE Raw result 4/28: Complete "virtual-time" coverage of live Raw – final PPV hype, Bryan returns from injury, Flair, Tag Title match, Tourney Finals, more|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwerawreport/article_78047.shtml|work=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=May 6, 2014}} At [[Extreme Rules (2014)|Extreme Rules]], Wyatt defeated Cena in a [[Professional wrestling match types#Steel Cages|steel cage match]], after repeated interference from the rest of the Wyatt Family members and a demonic child.{{cite web|last=Caldwell|first=James|title=Caldwell's Extreme Rules PPV results 5/4: Complete "virtual-time" coverage of live PPV – Bryan vs. Kane, Evolution vs. Shield, Cena vs. Wyatt steel cage match.|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/PPV_Reports_5/article_78185.shtml|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140506113832/http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/PPV_Reports_5/article_78185.shtml|archivedate=May 6, 2014|work=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=May 6, 2014}} Cena's feud with Wyatt continued with a [[Professional wrestling match types#Last Man Standing match|Last Man Standing]] match being set up for [[Payback (2014)|Payback]], where Cena buried Wyatt under multiple equipment cases to win the match.{{cite web|last1=Asher|first1=Matthew|title=Shield gets suicidal and Cena looks for some Payback against Wyatt|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2014/06/01/21709566.html|work=SLAM! Wrestling|accessdate=June 2, 2014}} On the June 16 episode of ''Raw'', Cena defeated [[Kane (wrestler)|Kane]] in a [[Professional wrestling match types#Stretcher match|stretcher match]] to qualify for the [[ladder match]] for the vacant WWE World Heavyweight Championship at [[Money in the Bank (2014)|Money in the Bank]], where Cena won his 15th world championship.{{cite web|title=WWE Money in the Bank 2014 results|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/moneyinthebank/2014/money-in-the-bank-2014-results-26441729|publisher=WWE|accessdate=June 30, 2014}} Cena then retained the title at [[Battleground (2014)|Battleground]] in a fatal four-way match against [[Roman Reigns]], Randy Orton and Kane.{{cite web|title=WWE Battleground 2014 results|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/wwebattleground/2014/wwe-world-heavyweight-championship-fatal-4-way-match-26445204|publisher=WWE|accessdate=July 20, 2014}} At [[SummerSlam (2014)|SummerSlam]], Cena lost the championship to [[Brock Lesnar]] in a [[Glossary of professional wrestling terms#Squash|squash match]], during which Lesnar hit Cena with sixteen [[suplex]]es and two ''F-5s'', ending his reign at 49 days.{{cite news|last1=Hooton|first1=Christopher|title=WWE SummerSlam 2014 results: Brock Lesnar destroys John Cena while Stephanie McMahon steals the show|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/general/wwe-mma-wrestling/wwe-summerslam-2014-results-how-did-brock-lesnar-john-cena-and-roman-reigns-get-on-9675284.html|work=[[The Independent]]|accessdate=November 5, 2014}} Cena invoked his title rematch clause against Lesnar for [[Night of Champions (2014)|Night of Champions]], nearly winning before [[Seth Rollins]] attacked him to cause a disqualification, although he became the first wrestler to defeat Lesnar in two WWE pay-per-view events.{{cite web|last1=Namako|first1=Jason|title=WWE Main Event Results – 8/19/14 (Big Show vs. Rowan)|url=http://www.wrestleview.com/wwe-news/50289-wwe-main-event-results-8-19-14-big-show-vs-rowan|website=wrestleview.com|accessdate=August 20, 2014}}{{cite web|last=Caldwell|first=James|title=Caldwell's WWE NoC PPV Report 9/21: Complete "virtual-time" coverage of live PPV – Lesnar vs. Cena|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wweppvs/article_80844.shtml|accessdate=September 21, 2014|date=September 21, 2014}} Cena then began feuding with [[Dean Ambrose]] for the right to face Rollins at [[Hell in a Cell (2014)|Hell in a Cell]], but Ambrose won the right by defeating Cena in a [[Professional wrestling match types#Hardcore-based variations|No Holds Barred]] [[Professional wrestling match types#(Object) on a Pole match|Contract on a Pole match]].{{cite web|last1=Tedesco|first1=Mike|title=WWE RAW Results - 10/13/14 (John Cena vs. Dean Ambrose)|url=http://www.wrestleview.com/wwe-wrestling-results/wwe-raw-results/51183-wwe-raw-results-10-13-14-live-results-from-atlanta|publisher=wrestleview.com|accessdate=October 14, 2014}} Cena would instead face Randy Orton in a [[Hell in a Cell]] match to determine the #1 contender for the WWE World Heavyweight Championship, which Cena won.{{cite web|last1=Burdick|first1=Michael|title=WWE Hell in a Cell 2014 results|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/hellinacell/2014/john-cena-randy-orton-26725117|publisher=WWE|accessdate=October 26, 2014}} On October 27 episode of ''Raw'', Cena rejected The Authority's offer to join forces, which resulted in a [[Professional wrestling tag team match types#Elimination tag team matches|5-on-5 Survivor Series elimination tag match]] between Team Cena and Team Authority at [[Survivor Series (2014)|Survivor Series]].{{cite web|last1=Tedesco|first1=Mike|title=WWE RAW Results – 10/27/14 (John Cena vs. Seth Rollins)|url=http://www.wrestleview.com/wwe-wrestling-results/wwe-raw-results/51368-wwe-raw-results-10-27-14-live-results-from-san-antonio|website=wrestleview.com|accessdate=October 28, 2014}} Cena's team consisted of [[Dolph Ziggler]], [[Big Show]], Erick Rowan and [[Ryback]]; at Survivor Series, Show turned on Cena, causing Cena's elimination, but Ziggler eventually won the match for Team Cena with the interfering [[Sting (wrestler)|Sting]]'s help. Thus as per the match stipulation, The Authority were stripped from power and only Cena could bring them back.{{cite web|last1=Murphy|first1=Ryan|title=Team Cena def. Team Authority|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/survivorseries/2014/team-cena-team-authority-traditional-survivor-series-elimination-match-26758255|website=wwe.com|publisher=WWE|accessdate=November 23, 2014}} At [[TLC: Tables, Ladders & Chairs (2014)|TLC: Tables, Ladders, Chairs & Stairs]], Cena defeated Rollins in a tables match to retain his WWE World Heavyweight Championship No. 1 contender status. It was then announced that Cena would face Lesnar for the title at the [[Royal Rumble (2015)|Royal Rumble]].{{cite web|last1=Murphy|first1=Ryan|title=John Cena def. Seth Rollins (Tables Match)|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/wwetlc/2014/john-cena-seth-rollins-tables-match-26847148|website=wwe.com|publisher=WWE|accessdate=December 14, 2014}} On the December 29 episode of ''Raw'', Rollins and Big Show held guest host [[Edge (wrestler)|Edge]] hostage, forcing Cena to reinstate The Authority.{{cite web|last1=Keller|first1=Wade|title=Keller's WWE Raw report 12/29: Lesnar and Heyman show up, Ziggler vs. Rusev in a champion vs. champion match, Edge & Christian host, Bryan's big announcement|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwerawreport/article_82500.shtml|website=PWTorch.com|accessdate=December 31, 2014}} On the January 5 episode of ''Raw'', The Authority added Rollins to the title match at the Royal Rumble involving Cena and Lesnar, and Ziggler, Ryback and Rowan were "fired" for joining Team Cena at Survivor Series.{{cite web|last1=Tedesco|first1=Mike|title=WWE RAW Results - 1/5/15 (The Authority resumes power)|url=http://www.wrestleview.com/wwe-wrestling-results/wwe-raw-results/52403-wwe-raw-results-1-5-15-live-results-from-corpus-christi|website=wrestleview.com|accessdate=January 6, 2015}} On the January 19 episode of ''Raw'', Cena won a [[Professional wrestling match types#Handicap match|handicap match]] against Rollins, Big Show and Kane to retain his title shot at the Royal Rumble and win back the jobs of Ziggler, Ryback and Rowan.{{cite web|last1=Caldwell|first1=James|title=CALDWELL'S WWE RAW RESULTS 1/19: Complete "virtual-time" coverage of live Raw - final Rumble hype, big "Legends Reunion" theme, Brock Lesnar, Bryan's Raw in-ring return, more|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwerawreport/article_82830.shtml#.V53V-9KLTIU|work=Pro Wrestling Torch|date=January 19, 2015|accessdate=July 31, 2016}} At the Royal Rumble, Cena was unsuccessful in capturing the title.{{cite web|last1=Caldwell|first1=James|title=Royal Rumble PPV Report 1/25: Complete "virtual-time" coverage of Lesnar vs. Cena vs. Rollins for WWE Title, Royal Rumble, post-PPV Network show|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wweppvs/article_82945.shtml|website=PWTorch.com|accessdate=January 26, 2015}} ==== United States Champion (2015–2016) ==== [[File:United States Champion John Cena 2015 (cropped).jpg|thumb|Cena after defeating [[Rusev (wrestler)|Rusev]] for the United States Championship at WrestleMania 31]] Following the Royal Rumble, Cena began feuding with then [[WWE United States Championship|United States Champion]] [[Rusev (wrestler)|Rusev]] and at [[Fastlane (2015)|Fastlane]], Rusev defeated Cena to retain his title after Cena passed out to his submission, the [[Professional wrestling holds#Camel clutch|''Accolade'']], after Rusev hit Cena with a [[Professional wrestling attacks#Low blow|low blow]] following a distraction from his manager [[Lana (wrestling)|Lana]].{{cite web|last1=Caldwell|first1=James|title=WWE Fast Lane PPV results 2/22: Complete "virtual-time" coverage of Bryan vs. Reigns, Cena vs. Rusev, Sting-Hunter confrontation, final PPV before WM31|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wweppvs/article_83486.shtml|publisher=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=February 23, 2015}} In the following weeks, Cena challenged Rusev to a rematch, which was declined, and [[Stephanie McMahon]] decreed that Cena would not compete at [[WrestleMania 31]] unless Rusev agreed to a rematch.{{cite web|last1=Caldwell|first1=James|title=WWE Raw results 3/2: Ongoing "virtual-time" coverage of live Raw - Heyman speaks for Lesnar, Rollins-Daily Show angle, WM31 build continues|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwerawreport/article_83632.shtml|publisher=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=March 3, 2015}} On the March 9 episode of ''Raw'', Cena attacked Rusev, refusing to release the ''STF'' submission hold, causing Lana to grant Cena the match.{{cite web|last1=Tedesco|first1=Mike|title=WWE RAW Results - 3/9/15 (Orton gets revenge on Rollins)|url=http://www.wrestleview.com/wwe-wrestling-results/wwe-raw-results/53407-wwe-raw-results-3-9-15-live-results-from-pittsburgh|website=wrestleview.com|accessdate=March 10, 2015}} Cena defeated Rusev at WrestleMania to win the United States Championship for the fourth time, marking Rusev's first pinfall loss in the main roster.{{cite web|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wweppvs/article_84175.shtml|title=CALDWELL'S WM31 PPV RESULTS 3/29: Ongoing "virtual-time" coverage of WWE World Title match, Taker's return, Sting vs. Triple H, Cena vs. Rusev, more big matches|author=Caldwell, James|website=Pro Wrestling Torch|date=March 29, 2015|accessdate=March 29, 2015}} The following night on ''Raw'', Cena announced that he would issue an open challenge each week on ''Raw'' with his United States Championship on the line—he successfully defended his title against the likes of Dean Ambrose,{{cite web|last1=Caldwell|first1=James|title=CALDWELL'S WWE RAW RESULTS 3/30: Complete "virtual-time" coverage of live Raw - WM31 fall-out, Lesnar seeks & destroys, WWE Title match teased, Sting on WWE Network|url=https://www.pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwerawreport/article_84201.shtml|publisher=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=March 30, 2015}} [[Cody Rhodes|Stardust]], [[Wade Barrett|Bad News Barrett]], Kane, [[Sami Zayn]], [[Adrian Neville|Neville]], [[Zack Ryder]] and [[Antonio Cesaro|Cesaro]].{{citation needed|date=December 2017}} Cena retained his title against Rusev in a [[Professional wrestling match types#Strap match|Russian Chain match]] at [[Extreme Rules (2015)|Extreme Rules]] and a [["I Quit" match]] at [[Payback (2015)|Payback]].{{cite web|last1=Caldwell|first1=James|title=CALDWELL'S EXTREME RULES PPV REPORT 4/26: Complete "virtual-time" coverage of live PPV - Rollins vs. Orton steel cage, Cena vs. Rusev, Last Man Standing, more|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wweppvs/article_84687.shtml|publisher=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=April 27, 2015}}{{cite web|last1=Melok|first1=Bobby|title=United States Champion John Cena def. Rusev ("I Quit" Match)|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/wwepayback/2015/john-cena-rusev-i-quit-match-27332527|publisher=WWE|accessdate=May 17, 2015}} The following night on ''Raw'', Cena was attacked by then [[NXT Championship|NXT Champion]] [[Kevin Owens]], setting up a [[Professional wrestling matches#Champion vs. Champion match|Champion vs. Champion match]] at [[Elimination Chamber (2015)|Elimination Chamber]], where Owens defeated Cena, but Cena defeated Owens in a rematch at [[Money in the Bank (2015)|Money in the Bank]].{{cite web|last1=Melok|first1=Bobby|title=NXT Champion Kevin Owens def. United States Champion John Cena (Champion vs. Champion Match: Non-Title)|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/eliminationchamber/2015/john-cena-vs-kevin-owens-27409543|website=wwe.com|accessdate=May 31, 2015}}{{cite web|last1=Laboon|first1=Jeff|title=John Cena def. Kevin Owens|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/moneyinthebank/2015/john-cena-kevin-owens-27450146|website=wwe.com|accessdate=June 14, 2015}} Cena defeated Owens at [[Battleground (2015)|Battleground]] to retain the United States Championship and end the feud.{{cite web|last1=Caldwell|first1=James|title=WWE PPVs CALDWELL'S WWE BATTLEGROUND PPV REPORT 7/19: Complete "virtual-time" coverage of live PPV - Rollins vs. Lesnar, Cena vs. Owens III, Orton returns home, more|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wweppvs/article_86322.shtml|website=PWTorch.com|accessdate=July 19, 2015}} Cena then resumed his feud with then WWE World Heavyweight Champion Seth Rollins, with Rollins refusing Cena's challenges for the title. On the July 27 episode of Raw, The Authority forced Cena to defend the United States Championship against Rollins. Cena defeated Rollins despite suffering a legitimate [[Nasal fracture|broken nose]] during the match.{{cite web|last1=Caldwell|first1=James|title=CALDWELL'S WWE RAW RESULTS 7/27: Complete "virtual-time" coverage of live Raw - Cena vs. Rollins for U.S. Title, SSlam hype, Owens vs. RKO, two Divas matches, more|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwerawreport/article_86507.shtml|website=PWTorch.com|accessdate=July 27, 2015}}{{cite web|last1=|first1=|title=John Cena suffers broken nose on Raw|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/raw/2015-07-27/john-cena-broken-nose-injury-update-27719837|website=WWE.com|accessdate=July 27, 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150730204828/http://www.wwe.com/shows/raw/2015-07-27/john-cena-broken-nose-injury-update-27719837|archivedate=July 30, 2015}} Cena then faced Rollins in a "Winner Takes All" match at [[SummerSlam (2015)|SummerSlam]], for both the WWE World Heavyweight Championship and the United States Championship, which Cena lost after guest host [[Jon Stewart]], appearing to side with Cena, instead attacked him with a steel chair, ending Cena's reign at 147 days.{{cite web|last1=Artus|first1=Matthew|title=WWE World Heavyweight Champion Seth Rollins def. United States Champion John Cena in a Winner Takes All Match|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/summerslam/2015/seth-rollins-john-cena-27759334|website=wwe.com|accessdate=August 23, 2015}} Cena defeated Rollins to win the title for the fifth time at [[Night of Champions (2015)|Night of Champions]], a record in the WWE ownership era of the title.{{cite web|last1=Melok|first1=Bobby|title=John Cena def. Seth Rollins to win the United States Championship|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/nightofchampions/2015/seth-rollins-john-cena-united-states-championship-27892611|website=wwe.com|accessdate=September 20, 2015}} Cena then retained his title against Rollins the following night on ''Raw'' and then in a steel cage match at [[WWE Live from Madison Square Garden]],{{cite web|last1=com|first1=WWE.|title=United States Champion John Cena def. Seth Rollins in a Steel Cage Match|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/network-live-msg-lesnar-big-show/2015-10-03/results-28001373/page-7|website=wwwe.com|accessdate=October 3, 2015}} while also restarting his open challenges and successfully defend the title against [[The New Day (wrestling)|New Day]] members [[Xavier Woods]]{{cite web|last1=Caldwell|first1=James|title=CALDWELL'S WWE RAW RESULTS 9/28: Complete "virtual-time" coverage of live Raw - John Cena's Open Challenge, Paul Heyman, Reigns vs. Wyatt main event, MizTV, more|url=https://www.pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwerawreport/article_87742.shtml|publisher=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=September 28, 2015}} and [[Big E (wrestler)|Big E]]{{cite web|last1=Caldwell|first1=James|title=CALDWELL'S WWE RAW RESULTS 10/5: Complete "virtual-time" coverage of live Raw - Lesnar returns, Cena's Open Challenge, more|url=https://www.pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwerawreport/article_87868.shtml|publisher=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=October 5, 2015}} and [[Dolph Ziggler]].{{cite web|last1=Caldwell|first1=James|title=CALDWELL'S WWE RAW RESULTS 10/12: Complete "virtual-time" coverage of live Chicago Raw - Cena's U.S. Title Open Challenge, WWE Champ loses in main event, more|url=https://www.pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwerawreport/article_87965.shtml|publisher=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=October 12, 2015}} At [[Hell in a Cell (2015)|Hell in a Cell]], Cena lost the title to the returning [[Alberto Del Rio]] in an open challenge.{{cite web|last1=Artus|first1=Matthew|title=Alberto Del Rio def. U.S. Champion John Cena in the U.S. Open Challenge|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/hellinacell/2015/us-open-challenge-28045059|website=wwe.com|accessdate=October 25, 2015}} After a hiatus, Cena returned on the December 28 episode of ''Raw'', defeating Del Rio by disqualification in a rematch for the title.{{cite web|last1=Martin|first1=Adam|title=WWE RAW Results - 12/28/15 (John Cena vs. Alberto Del Rio)|url=http://www.wrestleview.com/wwe-wrestling-results/wwe-raw-results/57272-wwe-raw-results-12-28-15-live-results-from-brooklyn|website=wrestleview.com||accessdate=December 29, 2015}} On the January 7, 2016 episode of ''SmackDown'' taped on January 5, Cena aided [[Kalisto (wrestler)|Kalisto]] at ringside to victory against Del Rio.{{cite web|last1=Parks|first1=Greg|title=1/7 WWE Smackdown: Parks's Complete, Real-Time Report|url=https://www.pwtorch.com/site/2016/01/07/17-wwe-smackdown-parkss-complete-real-time-report/|publisher=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=January 7, 2016}} That same day, he underwent surgery on a shoulder injury, which would keep him out of action for an undisclosed amount of time.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/inside/john-cena-surgery-january-2016|title=John Cena undergoes shoulder surgery|last=Wortman|first=James|date=January 8, 2016|accessdate=January 13, 2016|publisher=WWE}} ==== Record-tying world championship reign (2016–2017) ==== Cena returned at [[WrestleMania 32]], helping [[Dwayne Johnson|The Rock]] fend off [[The Wyatt Family]].{{cite web|last1=Adkins|first1=Greg|title=John Cena returns and joins The Rock at WrestleMania|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/wrestlemania/32/rock-electrifies-att-stadium|website=WWE.com|accessdate=April 4, 2016}} Cena then made his full return on the Memorial Day edition of ''[[WWE Raw|Raw]]'' on May 30, four months earlier than had been expected for his type of injury.{{cite web|last1=Pappolla|first1=Ryan|title=John Cena announces his return date on Twitter|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/raw/article/john-cena-announces-return-twitter|publisher=WWE|accessdate=April 27, 2016}} He was confronted by [[A.J. Styles|AJ Styles]], only to be betrayed by Styles, who joined his former Club teammates [[Gallows and Anderson|Luke Gallows and Karl Anderson]] in attacking Cena.{{cite web|last=Tedesco|first=Mike|title=WWE RAW Results – 5/30/16 (Live results from Green Bay, AJ Styles and The Club attack John Cena, six man tag main event)|url=http://www.wrestleview.com/wwe-wrestling-results/wwe-raw-results/62559-wwe-raw-results-53016-john-cena-returns-ziggler-vs-corbin/|publisher=Wrestleview|accessdate=May 30, 2016}} This set up a match between Cena and Styles at [[Money in the Bank (2016)|Money in the Bank]],{{cite web|last1=Clapp|first1=John|title=John Cena vs. AJ Styles|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/moneyinthebank/2016/john-cena-aj-styles|publisher=WWE|accessdate=June 3, 2016}} which Styles won with interference from Gallows and Anderson.{{cite web|last=Caldwell|first=James|title=6/19 WWE MITB PPV Results – CALDWELL'S Complete Live Report|url=http://www.pwtorch.com/site/2016/06/19/619-wwe-mitb-ppv-results-caldwells-ongoing-live-report/|publisher=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=June 19, 2016}} On the July 4 episode of ''Raw'', Cena was again attacked by the Club, but was saved by [[Enzo & Cass|Enzo Amore and Big Cass]]. Subsequently, a six-man tag team match was made between the two teams for [[Battleground (2016)|Battleground]].{{cite web|last1=Caldwell|first1=James|title=7/4 WWE Raw Results – CALDWELL'S Complete Live TV Report|url=http://www.pwtorch.com/site/2016/07/04/rawjuly4results/|work=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=July 4, 2016}} On July 19 at the [[2016 WWE draft]], Cena was drafted to the SmackDown brand, while also defeating Club member [[Luke Gallows]] via pinfall in a singles contest.{{cite web|title=2016 WWE Draft results: WWE officially ushers in New Era|url=http://www.wwe.com/2016-wwe-draft-results|publisher=WWE|accessdate=July 19, 2016}} Cena, Amore and Cass defeated The Club at Battleground after Cena pinned Styles.{{cite web|last1=Powers|first1=Kevin|title=John Cena, Enzo Amore & Big Cass def. The Club|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/wwebattleground/2016/john-cena-enzo-amore-big-cass-the-club-result|publisher=WWE|accessdate=July 24, 2016}} Cena continued his feud with Styles,{{cite web|last1=Parks|first1=Greg|title=8/16 WWE Smackdown LIVE – Parks's Complete, Real-Time Report|url=http://www.pwtorch.com/site/2016/08/16/816-wwe-smackdown-live-parkss-complete-real-time-report/|work=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=August 17, 2016}} which resulted in him losing their match at [[SummerSlam (2016)|SummerSlam]] on August 21.{{cite web|last1=Clapp|first1=John|title=John Cena vs. AJ Styles|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/summerslam/2016/john-cena-vs-aj-styles|work=WWE|accessdate=August 2, 2016}}{{cite web|last=Caldwell|first=James|title=8/21 WWE Summerslam Results – CALDWELL'S Complete Live Report|url=http://www.pwtorch.com/site/2016/08/21/summerslam2016resultsfinal/|work=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=August 21, 2016}} With Styles later winning the renamed [[WWE Championship|WWE World Championship]], Cena challenged him and previous champion [[Dean Ambrose]] in a triple threat match for the title at [[No Mercy (2016)|No Mercy]].{{cite web|last1=Benigno|first1=Anthony|title=WWE World Champion AJ Styles vs. Dean Ambrose vs. John Cena|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/nomercy/2016/aj-styles-vs-dean-ambrose-vs-john-cena|work=WWE|accessdate=September 13, 2016}} He lost the match after being pinned by Styles, which came after Ambrose and Cena simultaneously made Styles submit, therefore restarting the match.{{cite web|last=Silverstein|first=Adam|title=WWE No Mercy 2016 results: Ziggler wins intercontinental title, Styles retains|url=http://www.cbssports.com/general/news/wwe-no-mercy-2016-results-live-updates-matches-card-start-time-highlights/|publisher=[[CBS Sports]]|date=October 10, 2016|accessdate=October 13, 2016}} Cena then took a hiatus from WWE to film ''[[American Grit]]'' season 2. On the December 13 episode of ''SmackDown Live'' it was announced that Cena would be returning on the December 27 episode.{{cite web|url=http://www.pwtorch.com/site/2016/12/13/1213-wwe-smackdown-live-parkss-ongoing-real-time-report/|title=12/13 WWE Smackdown LIVE – Parks's Ongoing, Real-Time Report|date=December 13, 2016|last=Parks|first=Greg|work=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=December 14, 2016}} On his return, he addressed rumors about him during the past year, stated that the New Era was "B.S.", and then challenged the winner of that night's championship match, which was AJ Styles, for the again renamed WWE Championship at the [[Royal Rumble (2017)|Royal Rumble]].{{cite web|url=http://www.pwtorch.com/site/2016/12/27/1227-wwe-smackdown-live-parkss-ongoing-real-time-report-including-three-title-matches-john-cenas-return/|title=12/27 WWE Smackdown LIVE – Parks's Ongoing, Real-Time Report, including three title matches, John Cena's return|date=December 27, 2016|last=Parks|first=Greg|work=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=December 27, 2016}} On January 29, 2017, Cena defeated Styles at the Royal Rumble to tie [[Ric Flair]] for the most world title reigns at 16,{{cite web|last=Powell|first=Jason|title=1/29 Powell's WWE Royal Rumble 2017 live review: AJ Styles vs. John Cena for the WWE Championship, Kevin Owens vs. Roman Reigns in a No DQ match for the WWE Universal Championship with Chris Jericho in a shark cage|url=http://prowrestling.net/site/2017/01/29/129-powells-wwe-royal-rumble-2017-live-review-aj-styles-vs-john-cena-wwe-championship-kevin-owens-vs-roman-reigns-no-dq-match-wwe-universal-championship-chris-jeri/|work=Pro Wrestling Dot Net|accessdate=January 29, 2017}} although Flair has actually won the world title several more times with the number 16 having been called "WWE mythology".{{cite magazine | last = Meltzer | first = Dave | authorlink = Dave Meltzer | date = February 6, 2017 | title = February 6, 2017 Wrestling Observer Newsletter: Royal Rumble review, Ronda Rousey retired, more | magazine = [[Wrestling Observer Newsletter]] | location = [[Campbell, California]] | issn = 1083-9593 | pages=6–7}} Cena then entered the [[Elimination Chamber (2017)|Elimination Chamber]] match as WWE Champion.{{cite web|title=WWE Championship Elimination Chamber Match|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/eliminationchamber/2017/wwe-championship-elimination-chamber-match|publisher=WWE|accessdate=January 17, 2017}} He was eliminated fourth after a ''Sister Abigail'' from Bray Wyatt, who went on to win the championship.{{cite web|last=Powell|first=Jason|title=2/12 Powell's WWE Elimination Chamber 2017 live review: John Cena vs. AJ Styles vs. Dean Ambrose vs. The Miz vs. Baron Corbin vs. Bray Wyatt in an Elimination Chamber match for the WWE Championship|url=http://prowrestling.net/site/2017/02/12/212-powells-wwe-elimination-chamber-2017-live-review-john-cena-vs-aj-styles-vs-dean-ambrose-vs-miz-vs-baron-corbin-vs-bray-wyatt-elimination-chamber-match-wwe/|work=Pro Wreslting Dot Net|accessdate=February 12, 2017}} Two nights later on ''SmackDown Live'', Cena lost a triple threat match against Wyatt for the championship in a match also featuring Styles.{{cite web|url=http://www.pwtorch.com/site/2017/02/14/kellers-wwe-smackdown-report-214-ongoing-coverage-bray-defending-wwe-title-cena-elimination-chamber-follow/|title=KELLER'S WWE SMACKDOWN REPORT 2/14: Ongoing coverage of Bray defending WWE Title against Cena, Elimination Chamber follow-up|date=February 14, 2017|last=Keller|first=Wade|work=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=February 14, 2017}} Cena then began a feud with The Miz; after Cena eliminated Miz from both the Elimination Chamber and a 10-man battle royal to face Wyatt at [[WrestleMania 33]], Miz came back in and eliminated Cena.{{cite web|url=http://www.pwtorch.com/site/2017/02/21/kellers-wwe-smackdown-report-221-results-battle-royal-determine-new-no-1-contender-wwe-championship-wrestlemania/|title=KELLER'S WWE SMACKDOWN REPORT 2/21: Results of Battle Royal to determine a new no. 1 contender for WWE Championship at WrestleMania|date=February 21, 2017|last=Keller|first=Wade|work=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=February 21, 2017}} The next week, Miz accused Cena of being a hypocrite due to his movie commitments, while Cena accused Miz of stealing other wrestlers' moves and personalities. Miz's wife [[Maryse Ouellet|Maryse]] then slapped Cena before Cena and his girlfriend [[Nikki Bella]] sent Miz and Maryse retreating.{{cite web|url=http://www.pwtorch.com/site/2017/02/28/228-wwe-smackdown-live-parkss-complete-real-time-report-including-luke-harper-vs-j-styles-1-contenders-match-mickie-james-vs-becky-lynch-two-three-falls/|title=2/28 WWE Smackdown LIVE – Parks's Complete, Real-Time Report, including Luke Harper vs. A.J. Styles in a #1 contender's match, Mickie James vs. Becky Lynch in two-out-of-three falls|date=February 28, 2017|last=Parks|first=Greg|work=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=February 28, 2017}} SmackDown GM Daniel Bryan then set up a [[Professional wrestling tag team match types#Mixed tag team match|mixed tag team match]] between the two pairs for WrestleMania 33,{{cite web|url=http://www.pwtorch.com/site/2017/03/14/kellers-wwe-smackdown-report-314-styles-shane-hype-miz-tv-addresses-cena-nikki-orton-addresses-bray-wyatt/|title=KELLER'S WWE SMACKDOWN REPORT 3/14: Styles-Shane hype, Miz TV addresses Cena & Nikki, Orton addresses Bray Wyatt|date=March 14, 2017|last=Keller|first=Wade|work=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=March 14, 2017}} which Cena and Bella won. Cena proposed [[marriage]] to Bella after the match and she accepted.{{cite web|last1=Powell|first1=Jason|title=Powell's WrestleMania 33 live review: Undertaker vs. Roman Reigns, Goldberg vs. Brock Lesnar for the WWE Universal Championship, AJ Styles vs. Shane McMahon, Seth Rollins vs. Triple H in an unsanctioned match|url=http://prowrestling.net/site/2017/04/02/powells-wrestlemania-33-live-review-undertaker-vs-roman-reigns-goldberg-vs-brock-lesnar-wwe-universal-championship-aj-styles-vs-shane-mcmahon-seth-rollins-vs-triple-h/|work=Pro Wreslting Dot Net|accessdate=April 2, 2017}} Cena then went on a hiatus from WWE to film season 2 of ''[[American Grit]]''. ==== Free agent (2017–present) ==== [[File:Cena March 2018.jpg|thumb|Cena in March 2018]] In July 2017, WWE dubbed Cena a "free agent" during the [[2017 WWE Superstar Shake-up|Superstar Shake-up]], meaning he would work for both the Raw and SmackDown brands.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/smackdown/article/john-cena-free-agent-status?sf88580054=1|title=What does John Cena's Free Agent status mean?|date=June 14, 2017|last=Melok|first=Bobby|work=[[WWE]].com|accessdate=June 15, 2017}} Following his return he quickly re-entered a feud with former rival Rusev, who Cena would challenge to a [[Professional wrestling match types|flag match]] with Rusev later accepting the challenge at [[Battleground (2017)|Battleground]], which Cena won.{{cite news|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/wwebattleground/2017/john-cena-rusev|title=Cena and Rusev to go to war in a Flag Match|publisher=WWE|accessdate=July 5, 2017}} On the August 1 episode of SmackDown Live, Cena faced [[Shinsuke Nakamura]] in the main event with the winner going on to face Jinder Mahal in the main event of SummerSlam with Mahal's WWE Championship on the line. Shinsuke would claim the upset victory over Cena with Cena giving Nakamura his seal of approval after the contest.{{cite web|last=Keller|first=Wade|title=KELLER'S WWE SMACKDOWN REPORT 7/25: Surprise return, Owens gloats and Styles wants rematch, Nakamura vs. Corbin|url=http://www.pwtorch.com/site/2017/07/25/kellers-wwe-smackdown-report-725-surprise-return-owens-gloats-styles-wants-rematch-nakamura-vs-corbin/|work=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=July 25, 2017}} Following this, Cena entered a feud with [[Baron Corbin]]. After defeating Jinder Mahal via disqualification on the August 15 episode of SmackDown, Corbin would attempt to cash-in his Money in the Bank briefcase but after interference from Cena, he was unsuccessful. This led to a match between Cena and Corbin at [[SummerSlam (2017)|SummerSlam]] which saw Cena walk away with the pinfall victory, thus ending the fued.{{cite web|title=John Cena def. Baron Corbin|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/summerslam/2017/john-cena-baron-corbin-results|work=WWE|date=August 20, 2017|accessdate=August 21, 2017}} After SummerSlam, Cena entered into a feud against [[Roman Reigns]], with a match being set for [[No Mercy (2017)|No Mercy]].{{cite web|last1=Burdick|first1=Michael|title=John Cena vs. Roman Reigns|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/nomercy/2017/john-cena-roman-reigns|work=WWE|accessdate=August 28, 2017}} In the weeks leading up to the match, the two cut various [[shoot (professional wrestling)#worked shoots|worked shoot promos]] on each other, going back and forth about what they perceive the other to be and why the crowds react the way they do. Over the course of the rivalry, the duo were also forced to team together in consecutive tag team matches defeating the likes of Samoa Joe and The Miz (on the August 21 episode of RAW) and The Club (on the August 28 episode of RAW). At No Mercy, Reigns defeated Cena after kicking out of a 'Super AA' and delivering a single spear.{{cite web|last1=Benigno|first1=Anthony|title=Roman Reigns def. John Cena|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/nomercy/2017/john-cena-roman-reigns-results|work=WWE|accessdate=September 24, 2017}} Despite sparking rumors of his retirement after the match by endorsing Reigns, taking a bow, thanking the crowd, and waving goodbye to them before leaving,{{cite web|url=https://prowrestling.net/site/2017/09/24/powells-wwe-no-mercy-2017-live-review-brock-lesnar-vs-braun-strowman-wwe-universal-championship-john-cena-vs-roman-reigns-dean-ambrose-seth-rollins-vs-sheamus-cesaro-th/|title=Powell's WWE No Mercy 2017 live review: Brock Lesnar vs. Braun Strowman for the WWE Universal Championship, John Cena vs. Roman Reigns, Dean Ambrose and Seth Rollins vs. Sheamus and Cesaro for the Raw Tag Titles - Pro Wrestling Dot Net|author=|date=September 24, 2017|website=prowrestling.net}} Cena returned to SmackDown the next month after Commissioner [[Shane McMahon]] named him the final member of Team SmackDown for the men's 5-on-5 elimination match against Team Raw at [[Survivor Series (2017)|Survivor Series]]; at the event, Cena was eliminated by [[Kurt Angle]] and Team SmackDown was later defeated.{{cite web|last1=Wortman|first1=James|title=Team Raw def. Team SmackDown in a Men's 5-on-5 Traditional Survivor Series Elimination Tag Team Match|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/survivorseries/2017/men-5-on-5-traditional-survivor-series-elimination-match-results|work=WWE|accessdate=November 19, 2017}} From January until April 2018, Cena was involved in a storyline where he was trying to find his "path to WrestleMania". After he lost the [[Royal Rumble (2018)|Royal Rumble]] and the namesake Elimination Chamber match to determine the next number one contender for the [[WWE Universal Championship|Universal Championship]] at [[Elimination Chamber (2018)|Elimination Chamber]], as well as a [[Professional wrestling match types#Basic non-elimination matches|six-pack challenge]] at [[Fastlane (2018)|Fastlane]] for the WWE Championship, Cena issued a challenge to [[The Undertaker]] for a match at [[WrestleMania 34]]. He repeated his challenge over the next several weeks, only to receive no answer from Undertaker. On the March 19 episode of RAW, after calling out The Undertaker yet again, Cena was confronted and choke slammed by Undertaker's storyline brother Kane. This led to a no-disqualification match between the two a week later which Cena won. After the match, Cena called out The Undertaker again to no response. At WrestleMania 34, after Cena drove off [[Elias (wrestler)|Elias]] in a confrontation, Undertaker returned and accepted Cena's challenge, leading to a shocked Cena losing to Undertaker in just a few minutes. Three weeks later, at the [[WWE Greatest Royal Rumble|Greatest Royal Rumble]], Cena defeated [[Triple H]].{{cite web|last1=Benigno|first1=Anthony|title=John Cena def. Triple H|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/greatest-royal-rumble/2018/john-cena-triple-h-results|website=WWE.com|accessdate=1 May 2018}} After the match he thanked the crowd for sticking by him during a tough period, referencing his loss to Undertaker at WrestleMania and his recent breakup with [[Nikki Bella]]. He then went on hiatus to focus on his acting and television career.{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} On August 10, it was announced Cena would face [[Kevin Owens]] at [[WWE Super Show-Down]] in [[Melbourne, Australia]]. On August 20, the match was later changed to a tag team contest with Cena teaming with former rival [[Bobby Lashley]] to take on the team of Owens and Elias. On September 2, Cena debuted a new finishing move whilst teaming with Lashley and [[Finn Balor]] against Elias, Jinder Mahal and Baron Corbin at a live event in Shanghai. Having hyped the match on Twitter over the weeks leading to the event, Cena would declare he was set to unveil his 'sixth move of doom' - a reference to the criticism he has received for the perceived limitations in his move set - the move would end up being a variation of a lightning fist, which he used to pin Elias.{{Citation|last=The WWE Insider|title=John Cena DEBUTS New Finisher at WWE Live Event in Shanghai 'The Lightning Fist' (HD)|date=2018-09-01|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iVYnYsvfn_k|access-date=2018-09-08}} At Super Show-Down, Cena and Lashley defeated Owens and Elias, with Cena once again using Lighting Fist as his finishing move.{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} On the October 8 episode of ''Raw'', it was announced that Cena would represent Raw in the interbrand eight-man WWE World Cup Tournament at [[WWE Crown Jewel]]. On SmackDown 1000, Cena appeared via satellite where he reminisced on his debut, stating he regretted slapping Kurt Angle but never regretted starting out his career on SmackDown. A week later on ''RAW'', Angle evaluated his World Cup competition, including Cena. On the October 29 episode of ''Raw'', after Bobby Lashley would get himself disqualified in a singles contest against Finn Balor, acting General Manager, Baron Corbin, rewarded Lashley's display of dominance with a spot in the eight-man WWE World Cup Tournament at the expense of Cena who was the only superstar in the tournament who hadn't actually qualified. This was done as Cena had legitimately refused to work the event following the murder of Saudi Journalist [[Jamal Khashoggi]]. == Professional wrestling style and persona == [[File:Cena FU Animated.gif|thumb|260px|Cena performing his finishing move, a [[Professional wrestling throws#Fireman's carry takeover|fireman's carry takeover]] known as the ''Attitude Adjustment'' (formerly called the ''F-U'') on [[Kane (wrestler)|Kane]]]] Cena's original [[Gimmick (professional wrestling)|gimmick]] portrayed that of a white rapper who wore jerseys, backwards hats, and a chain with a padlock around his neck, was known as the "Doctor of Thuganomics". First as ''"The Prototype"'', and later under his real name, Cena sometimes used underhanded tactics to score victories, such as using his chain as a weapon behind the referee's back.{{Cite web | title = John Cena’s embarrassing beginning | author = | work = NewsComAu | date = 11 April 2016 | accessdate = 2018-07-13 | url = https://www.news.com.au/sport/more-sports/john-cena-began-career-horribly-as-the-prototype/news-story/b89ddb936c5f1e5fb548c9bc05e1171d | language = | quote = }} Cena often rapped before his matches, insulting his opponents, events that happened in the media, and even the crowd. Cena also regularly performed "rap battles", where he and his opponent took turns rapping on each other. Cena reverted to this persona once during his feud with [[Dwayne Johnson|The Rock]]. In 2005, shortly after his first debut film, ''[[The Marine]]'', his wrestling character was shifted from a rapper to that of a young military upstart.{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} After WWE's change from TV-14 to TV-PG in mid 2008, the name of his finishing move, the ''[[Professional wrestling throws#Fireman's carry takeover|F-U]]'', was changed to the ''Attitude Adjustment'' in order to fit with WWE's new policies.{{citeweb|url=https://prowrestling.net/artman/publish/WWE/article1004487.shtml|title= John Cena says it was his call to change his finishing move name, predicts that three wrestlers will be WWE stars|website=Pro Wrestling Dot Net|date=February 5, 2009|accessdate=July 23, 2018}} During his career, he is known for ending his matches with a sequence of moves, dubbed "The Five Moves of Doom". The moves typically go in the order as follows: flying shoulder block, sit-out hip toss, side-release spinout powerbomb, ''Five Knuckle Shuffle'' and ''Attitude Adjustment''.{{cite web|url=http://grantland.com/features/grantland-dictionary-pro-wrestling-edition/|title=Grantland Dictionary: Pro Wrestling Edition|first=David|last=Shoemaker|date=August 13, 2014|website=grantland.com}} During the summer of 2018, Cena hyped a sixth move. On September 1, Cena executed the move, known as the "Lightning Fist", a high-impact left handed jab to the opponent.{{cite web|url=https://www.solowrestling.com/new/73936-john-cena-regresa-a-la-accion-anadiendo-un-nuevo-movimiento-a-su-arsenal|title=John Cena regresa a la acción añadiendo un nuevo movimiento a su arsenal|first=|last=Solowrestling|date=September 3, 2018|website=solowrestling.com}} Cena has portrayed a heroic character throughout his WWE career, with the exception of a villainous run in 2002–2003. Cena's signature ring gear includes jean shorts, sneakers, wristbands, and armbands. Cena also wears a variety of T-shirts and baseball caps, which commonly include one of his catchphrases such as "never give up", "you can't see me", "hustle, loyalty, respect" and "respect. Earn it".{{cite web|url=https://www.wwe.com/shows/smackdown/gallery/john-cena-new-gear-photos#fid-40081561|title=John Cena's new gear: photos|work=[[WWE|WWE.com]]|accessdate=August 29, 2018}} Cena has a history of returning from actual (and [[kayfabe]]) injuries much sooner than expected. In 2016, ESPN reporter David Shoemaker said, "Never underestimate Cena's recuperative abilities. He's somewhere on the recovery scale between German [[platelet-rich plasma]] therapy and [[Deadpool]]."{{cite web|last=Shoemaker|first=David|title=The highs and lows of a record-breaking WrestleMania 32|url=http://espn.go.com/espn/story/_/id/15132979/the-highs-lows-wrestlemania-32|publisher=[[ESPN]]|date=April 5, 2016|accessdate=April 18, 2017}} [[Big Show]] stated he felt the most stable to be lifted by Cena, despite Cena being over 200 lbs lighter and almost a foot shorter, a testament to Cena's [[Functional training|functional strength]].{{Citation|last=WWE|title=Big Show reveals who WWE's strongest athletes are, on WWE Network's Table for 3|date=September 26, 2016|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KIn7k__fhmY|accessdate=December 11, 2017}} === Fashion === During his WWE career, Cena's attire has attempted to reflect the most current fashions and stylings within the [[hip hop culture]] that his [[Glossary of professional wrestling terms#Gimmick|character]] represents. Cena started out wearing "[[Mitchell & Ness|throwback jerseys]]" until WWE produced specific Cena merchandise which he began wearing.{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} While Cena was a member of the ''SmackDown'' brand, one of his WWE produced T-shirts bore the suggestive [[spoonerism]] "Ruck Fules". Whenever it appeared on television the image was censored, not by the network, but by WWE to sell more shirts under the premise that it was "too hot for TV".{{cite web|url=http://www.oowrestling.com/columns/oo/20050126.shtml|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090107015531/http://www.oowrestling.com/columns/oo/20050126.shtml|deadurl=yes|archivedate=January 7, 2009|title=RAW/Rating, SD! is CANCELLED~!, Plus: ECW PPV, Importance of Maturity, and More!|accessdate=February 12, 2007|publisher=Online Onslaught|df=}} He also wore a chain with a large [[Lock (security device)|padlock]], occasionally using it as a [[Foreign object (professional wrestling)|weapon]],{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} until [[WrestleMania 21]], when it was replaced with a [[Bling-bling|chromed and diamond studded]] "Chain Gang" [[Spinner (wheel)|spinner]] medallion – reminiscent of the ones worn by members of [[G-Unit]] – matching his spinner title belt. Around the time ''[[The Marine]]'' was released, Cena began wearing attire more military related, including [[Military camouflage|camouflage]] shorts, [[Dog tag (identifier)|dog tags]], a [[United States Marine Corps|Marine]] soldier cap, and a WWE produced shirt with the legend "Chain Gang Assault Battalion".{{cite web|url=http://shopzone.wwe.com/product_detail.asp?productId=10-00492 |title=John Cena Studio Fathead |accessdate=October 8, 2007 |publisher=Shopzone.WWE.com |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071113060457/http://shopzone.wwe.com/product_detail.asp?productId=10-00492 |archivedate=November 13, 2007 }} Shortly after [[WrestleMania 23]], when promotion for ''The Marine'' ended, the military attire diminished and was replaced with apparel bearing his new slogan "American Made Muscle" along with denim shorts, not seen since he was a member of the ''SmackDown'' roster.{{cite web|url=http://shopzone.wwe.com/product_detail.asp?productId=50-02544&cartID=2007100721501321831024118 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071113061101/http://shopzone.wwe.com/product_detail.asp?productId=50-02544&cartID=2007100721501321831024118 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=November 13, 2007 |title=John Cena Youth American Made Muscle Package |accessdate=October 8, 2007 |publisher=Shopzone.WWE.com |df= }} He then wore shirts that promoted Cenation and his trademark line "You Can't See Me". == Legacy == Cena has been named as the greatest professional wrestler of all time by peers [[Kurt Angle]]{{cite web|last1=Schwartz|first1=Nick|title=Kurt Angle on how WWE has changed, and why John Cena is the G.O.A.T. WWE Superstar|url=http://www.foxsports.com/wwe/gallery/wwe-kurt-angle-john-cena-hall-of-fame-interview-wizard-world|publisher=[[Fox Sports]]|accessdate=March 18, 2017}} and [[John Layfield|John "Bradshaw" Layfield]], as well as by veteran industry personality [[Paul Heyman]].{{cite web|url=http://www.news.com.au/sport/sports-life/why-john-cena-is-the-best-of-all-time/news-story/c9e166b82caa2ba63e01fc3e3bd40293|title=Why John Cena is the best of all time|last=Santarossa|first=Adam|accessdate=February 8, 2017}} == Acting career == === Film === [[File:John Cena - The Marine premiere.jpg|thumb|Cena, with members of the [[United States Marine Corps]], at the premiere of his film ''[[The Marine]]'']] [[WWE Studios]], a division of WWE which produces and finances motion pictures, produced Cena's first movie – ''[[The Marine]]'', which was distributed theatrically by [[20th Century Fox]] America beginning on October 13, 2006. In its first week, the film made approximately US$7 million at the United States box office.{{cite web|url=http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/marine/numbers.php|title=The Marine: Box Office Summary|publisher=RottenTomatoes.com|accessdate=July 4, 2007|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070629232818/http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/marine/numbers.php|archivedate=June 29, 2007}} After ten weeks in theaters, the film grossed $18.7 million. Once the film was released on DVD, it fared better, making $30 million in rentals in the first twelve weeks. [[File:Cena.jpg|thumb|left|upright|Cena filming on the set of ''12 Rounds'']] His second film, also produced by WWE Studios, was ''[[12 Rounds (film)|12 Rounds]]''.{{cite news|url=http://www.mensfitness.com/lifestyle/entertainment/236|title=John Cena on Acting|last=Millado|first=Nate|date=March 2009|work=[[Men's Fitness]]|accessdate=March 16, 2009}} Filming began on February 25, 2008, in New Orleans;{{cite web|url=http://blog.nola.com/business_of_film/2007/12/state_film_office_announces_20.html|title=State Film Office announces 2007 statistics|first=Roberta|last=Carrow-Jackson|publisher=NOLA.com|date=December 7, 2007|accessdate=January 11, 2008}} the film was released on March 27, 2009. Cena co-starred in his third film produced by WWE Studios, titled ''[[Legendary (film)|Legendary]]'', which was played in selected theaters starting on September 10, 2010, for a limited time,{{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/movie/legendary/details|title=Legendary (2010): Reviews|accessdate=September 13, 2010|publisher=[[Metacritic]]}} then it was released on DVD on September 28, 2010.{{cite web|url=http://www.blu-ray.com/movies/Legendary-Blu-ray/12410/|title=Legendary Blu-ray|publisher=Blu-ray.com|accessdate=March 28, 2011}} That same year, Cena starred in the children's film ''[[Fred: The Movie]]'', a film based on [[Lucas Cruikshank]]'s YouTube videos of the [[Fred Figglehorn|same name]], where he plays Fred's imaginary father.{{cite web|date=July 20, 2010|url=https://twitter.com/LucasCruikshank/status/18970723212|title=LucasCruikshank|work=Twitter|accessdate=July 20, 2010}} The movie was first aired on [[Nickelodeon]] in September 2010.{{cite news|first=Lorenzo|last=Benet|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20427194,00.html|title=5 Things to Know About Lucas Cruikshank|accessdate=September 20, 2010|date=September 18, 2010|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]}} In 2015, Cena made appearances in the comedy films ''[[Trainwreck (film)|Trainwreck]]'',{{cite web|url=http://www.slashfilm.com/judd-apatow-trainwreck-casting/|title=Judd Apatow's 'Trainwreck' Casts Up: Tilda Swinton, Barkhad Abdi and John Cena Sign On - /Film|date=March 18, 2014|publisher=|accessdate=December 30, 2016}} ''[[Sisters (2015 film)|Sisters]]''{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2014/07/wwe-john-cena-the-nest-tina-fey-amy-poehler-villain-798658/|title=WWE Star John Cena To Turn Heel In Universal Comedy 'The Nest'|first=Jen|last=Yamato|date=July 1, 2014|publisher=|accessdate=December 30, 2016}} and a cameo in ''[[Daddy's Home (film)|Daddy's Home]]''.{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2015/film/reviews/daddys-home-review-will-ferrell-mark-wahlberg-1201665411/|title=Film Review: 'Daddy's Home'|last=Berkshire|first=Geoff|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|accessdate=May 12, 2017}} He was the [[Safety car|pace car]] driver for the [[2016 Daytona 500|58th annual Daytona 500]].{{cite web|url=http://www.foxsports.com/nascar/shake-and-bake/john-cena-daytona-500-wrestlemania-32-wwe-set-drive-pace-car-but-coy-sprint-cup-022116|title=John Cena honorary pace car driver|last=Jensen|first=Tom|date=February 21, 2016|accessdate=February 21, 2016|publisher=[[Fox Sports (United States)|Fox Sports]]}} In 2017, Cena lent his voice for the animated film, ''[[Ferdinand (film)|Ferdinand]].''{{cite news|url=http://www.today.com/popculture/john-cena-ferdinand-trailer-t109688|title=Watch the trailer for John Cena's new animated movie ''Ferdinand''|author=Randee Dawn|date=March 28, 2017|accessdate=March 28, 2017}} He also appeared ''[[Daddy's Home 2]]'', reprising his role from the 2015 film. In 2018, Cena starred in the comedy ''[[Blockers (film)|Blockers]]'', and will have a leading role in the ''[[Transformers (film series)|Transformers]]'' spin-off prequel, ''[[Bumblebee (film)|Bumblebee]]''. === Guest appearances === Before his WWE debut, Cena made an appearance on the [[webcast]] ''Go Sick'' as Bruebaker, an angry, cursing wrestler in 2001.{{cite web|url=http://www.atomfilms.com/film/go_sick_psycho.jsp|title=Go Sick: Psycho Auditions|accessdate=April 6, 2007|publisher=AtomFilms|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070410013938/http://www.atomfilms.com/film/go_sick_psycho.jsp|archivedate=April 10, 2007|df=}} [[File:John Cena 134616.jpg|thumb|upright|Cena in 2008]] During his WWE career, Cena has appeared on ABC's ''[[Jimmy Kimmel Live!]]'' three times. Cena has also appeared on morning radio shows; including the [[CBS Radio|CBS]] and [[XM Satellite Radio|XM]] versions of [[Opie and Anthony]] as part of their "walkover" on October 10, 2006. Other appearances have included NBC's ''[[Late Night with Conan O'Brien]]'', [[Fuse TV|Fuse's]] ''Celebrity Playlist'', [[Fox Sports Net]]'s ''[[The Best Damn Sports Show Period]]'', FOX's ''[[MADtv]]'', ''[[G4's Training Camp]]'' (with [[Shelton Benjamin]]), and two appearances on MTV's ''[[Punk'd]]'' (August 2006 and May 2007), as the victim of a [[practical joke]]. He also served as a co-presenter, with [[Hulk Hogan]], at the 2005 [[Teen Choice Awards]], as a guest judge during the third week of the 2006 season of ''[[Nashville Star]]'', and appeared at the [[Nickelodeon UK Kids Choice Awards 2007|2007 Nickelodeon UK Kids Choice Awards]].{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/inside/overtheropes/news/cenanickuk|title=Cena on Nick U.K. Kids' Choice Awards|last=Medalis|first=Kara A.|accessdate=October 30, 2007|publisher=WWE|date=October 26, 2007}} In January 2007, Cena, [[Dave Batista|Batista]], and [[Ashley Massaro]] appeared representing WWE on an episode of ''[[Extreme Makeover: Home Edition]]'',{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/inside/news/homemakeover|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070115030617/http://www.wwe.com/inside/news/homemakeover|archivedate=January 15, 2007|title=WWE Superstars aid family's "Extreme Makeover"|last=Hunt|first=Jen|author2=Mike McAvennie|accessdate=August 2, 2007|publisher=WWE}} giving the children of the family whose house was being renovated WWE merchandise and eight tickets to [[WrestleMania 23]].{{cite video|title=John Cena, Batista, and Ashley on Extreme Makeover: Home Edition|url=http://www.wwe.com/content/media/video/specialty_clips/wwehomemakeover|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070626131807/http://www.wwe.com/content/media/video/specialty_clips/wwehomemakeover|archivedate=June 26, 2007|medium=WMV|publisher=WWE|accessdate=August 1, 2007}} Two months later, he and [[Bobby Lashley]] appeared on the [[NBC]] game show ''[[Deal or No Deal (US game show)|Deal or No Deal]]'' as "moral support" to longtime WWE fan and front row staple, Rick "Sign Guy" Achberger. [[Edge (wrestler)|Edge]] and [[Randy Orton]] also appeared, but as antagonists.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/inside/news/dealofalifetime|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070303065644/http://www.wwe.com/inside/news/dealofalifetime|archivedate=March 3, 2007|title=Sign-ing a Deal?|author=Zack Zeigler|accessdate=May 25, 2007|date=March 1, 2007|publisher=WWE}} On April 9, 2008, Cena, along with fellow wrestlers [[Triple H]] and [[Chris Jericho]], appeared on the ''[[Idol Gives Back]]'' fund-raising special.{{cite web|url=http://www.ctv.ca/servlet/ArticleNews/show/CTVShows/20080408/presidential_idol_080408/20080408/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080412011348/http://www.ctv.ca/servlet/ArticleNews/show/CTVShows/20080408/presidential_idol_080408/20080408/ |dead-url=yes |archive-date=April 12, 2008 |title=Presidential hopefuls among 'Idol Gives Back' stars |accessdate=April 10, 2008 |publisher=[[CTV Television Network|CTV]] |df= }} In March 2009, Cena made an appearance on ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' during the show's cold opening sequence.{{cite episode|title=Tracy Morgan/Kelly Clarkson|series=Saturday Night Live|network=[[NBC]]|airdate=March 14, 2009|season=[[Saturday Night Live (season 34)|34]]|number=654|minutes=90–92 }} On March 7, 2009, he was a guest on [[NPR]]'s quiz show ''[[Wait Wait... Don't Tell Me!]]'' in a Not My Job sequence titled "Sure, pro wrestling is a good gig, but when you win, do they throw teddy bears into the ring?".{{cite web|url=https://www.npr.org/templates/rundowns/rundown.php?prgId=35&prgDate=03-07-2009&view=storyview|title=Wait Wait... Don't Tell Me!|accessdate=June 25, 2009|publisher=[[National Public Radio]]}} === Television === In 2001, between his training in Ultimate Pro Wrestling and [[Ohio Valley Wrestling]],{{cite web|url=http://www.realitynewsonline.com/cgi-bin/ae.pl?mode=1&article=article1970.art&page=1|title=''Whatever Happened to Manhunt's "Big Tim"?''|accessdate=June 13, 2006|publisher=Reality News Online|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060118065404/http://www.realitynewsonline.com/cgi-bin/ae.pl?mode=1&article=article1970.art&page=1|archivedate=January 18, 2006}} Cena was involved in the [[UPN]] produced reality show ''[[Manhunt (2001 TV series)|Manhunt]]'', in which he portrayed Big Tim Kingman, leader of the group of [[bounty hunter]]s who chased down the contestants who acted as fugitives. The show, however, was mired in controversy when it was alleged that the portions of the show were rigged to eliminate certain players, scenes were re-shot or staged to enhance drama and contestants read from scripts.{{cite web|url=http://www.realitytvhallofshame.com/cgi-bin/ae.pl?mode=4&article=article1062.art&page=1|title=Article on ''Manhunt''|accessdate=June 13, 2006|publisher=Reality TV Hall of Shame|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060822171035/http://www.realitytvhallofshame.com/cgi-bin/ae.pl?mode=4&article=article1062.art&page=1|archivedate=August 22, 2006|df=mdy-all}}{{cite web|url=http://www.realitynewsonline.com/cgi-bin/ae.pl?mode=2&page=page1013.php|title=''Manhunt'' overview|accessdate=June 13, 2006|publisher=Reality News Online|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060507001951/http://www.realitynewsonline.com/cgi-bin/ae.pl?mode=2&page=page1013.php|archivedate=May 7, 2006}}{{cite web|url=http://www.realitynewsonline.com/cgi-bin/ae.pl?mode=1&article=article1339.art&page=1|title=Article on ''Manhunt'' scandal|accessdate=June 13, 2006|publisher=Reality News Online|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060502132107/http://www.realitynewsonline.com/cgi-bin/ae.pl?mode=1&article=article1339.art&page=1|archivedate=May 2, 2006}} Cena was featured on the [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]] reality series ''[[Fast Cars and Superstars: The Gillette Young Guns Celebrity Race]]'', which aired in June 2007,{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/inside/news/cenarevvedup|title=Cena gets revved up|first=Kara A.|last=Medalis|date=March 12, 2007|accessdate=March 20, 2007|publisher=WWE}} making it to the final round before being eliminated on June 24, placing third in the competition overall.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/inside/news/cenanascar5|title=Cena races into third on 'Fast Cars' finale|first=Kara A.|last=Medalis|publisher=WWE|accessdate=July 8, 2007|date=June 25, 2007}} In 2007, Cena was interviewed for the ''[[CNN Special Investigations Unit]]'' documentary, ''Death Grip: Inside Pro Wrestling'', which focused on steroid and drug use in professional wrestling. When asked if he had taken steroids he was heard to reply, "I can't tell you that I haven't, but you will never prove that I have".{{cite news|url=http://www.newburyportnews.com/punews/local_story_317094010|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20120904215800/http://www.newburyportnews.com/punews/local_story_317094010|deadurl=yes|archivedate=September 4, 2012|title=WWE wrestles CNN over Cena interview response|last=Atkinson |first=Dan|date=November 13, 2007|work=[[The Daily News of Newburyport]]|accessdate=March 24, 2009|df=}} The day after the documentary aired, WWE accused CNN of taking Cena's comments out of context to present a biased point of view, backing up their claim by posting an unedited video of Cena answering the same question – filmed by WWE cameras from another angle – in which he is heard beginning the same statement with "absolutely not".{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/inside/cenaoncnnvideo/|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071116081321/http://www.wwe.com/inside/cenaoncnnvideo/|deadurl=yes|archivedate=November 16, 2007|title=Cena: Steroids? Absolutely not|accessdate=November 18, 2007|publisher=WWE|df=}} A text interview on the website with Cena later had him saying the news outlet should apologize for misrepresenting him,{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/inside/news/cenarespondstocnn|title=Cena reacts to CNN|accessdate=November 18, 2007|publisher=WWE}} which CNN refused, saying they felt the true answer to the question began with the phrase "my answer to that question".{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/inside/news/noapology|title=CNN to WWE: No Apology|accessdate=November 18, 2007|publisher=WWE}} However, they did edit the documentary on subsequent airings to include the "absolutely not". Cena hosted the Australian [[Nickelodeon Kids Choice Awards]] with [[Natalie Bassingthwaighte]] on October 11, 2008, in [[Melbourne]].{{cite news|url=http://www.news.com.au/perthnow/story/0,21598,24476906-5005368,00.html|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5hbyBMmEK?url=http://www.news.com.au/perthnow/story/0,21598,24476906-5005368,00.html|archivedate=June 18, 2009|title=WWE champion John Cena to host Nickelodeon awards|last=Ganska|first=Helen|date=October 12, 2008|work=[[The Sunday Times (Western Australia)]]|accessdate=March 2, 2009|deadurl=yes|df=mdy}} Cena guest starred as Ewan O'Hara, brother of [[Juliet O'Hara]], in an episode of the fourth season of the comedy drama ''[[Psych]]''.{{cite news|url=http://tv.ign.com/articles/101/1011064p1.html|title=WWE's John Cena Guests on Psych|last=Goldman|first=Eric|date=August 5, 2009|publisher=IGN|accessdate=August 28, 2009}} He also guest starred as himself in the seventh episode of [[Disney Channel]]'s ''[[Hannah Montana|Hannah Montana Forever]]''. On August 17, 2015, Cena guest co-hosted ''[[Today (U.S. TV program)|Today]]'' on [[NBC]].{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/summerslam/2015/john-cena-today-nbc-27805647|title=John Cena guest co-hosts 'Today'|author=WWE.com Staff|publisher=WWE|date=August 17, 2015}} He co-hosted the show again on December 28 and 29, 2015.{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} Cena appeared on ''[[Late Night with Seth Meyers]]'' on August 21, 2015. Cena co-hosted ''[[Today (U.S. TV program)|Today]]'' again on March 28–30 and May 9, 10, 13 and 30, 2016. Cena hosts ''[[American Grit]]'' on [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]], which is a reality television series with 10 episodes. 16 men and women were split into four teams, where challenges were given. A $1 million USD prize was given to the winning team.{{cite web|url=http://www.tvguide.com/tvshows/american-grit/904180/|title=American Grit TV Show|publisher=TV Guide|accessdate=March 18, 2016}} ''American Grit'' premiered on Fox on April 14, 2016. Cena has been retweeting motivational tweets from his followers on [[Twitter]] who used the hashtag #ShowYourGrit, in a way that the fan did something motivational to his/her friends in a real-life scenario. The finale of Season 1 aired on June 9, 2016. Cena hosted the [[ESPN]] [[ESPY Award]]s on July 13, 2016, in [[Los Angeles]].{{cite web|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/779560/john-cena-brings-the-funny-while-hosting-the-2016-espy-awards|title=John Cena's Best Hosting Moments at 2016 ESPYs|language=en-US|access-date=July 14, 2016}} On December 10, 2016, Cena was the guest host of ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' (''SNL'') on NBC.{{cite web|last1=Lawrence|first1=Derek|title='Saturday Night Live' recap: John Cena|url=http://ew.com/recap/saturday-night-live-season-42-episode-9/|work=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|accessdate=December 11, 2016|date=January 13, 2017}} On January 24, 2017, [[Nickelodeon]] announced that Cena would host the 2017 [[Nickelodeon Kids' Choice Awards]] ceremony on March 11. On January 11, 2018, it was announced that he would be hosting the awards ceremony again on March 24, 2018, becoming the third host behind [[Whitney Houston]], and [[Rosie O'Donnell]] to host the ceremony back to back years. In addition, he will be working in ''[[Rise of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles]]'' voicing a recurring villain named Baron Draxum.{{cite web|title=John Cena Joins Rise of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles|url=https://www.newsarama.com/38148-john-cena-joins-rise-of-the-teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles.html|website=Newsarama|date=11 January 2018|accessdate=11 January 2018}} == Music career == {{Infobox musical artist |name=John Cena |background=solo_singer |genre=[[Hip hop music|Hip hop]] |occupation= |years_active=2004–2005, 2014 |label=[[Columbia Records]], [[WWE Music Group]] |associated_acts=[[Tha Trademarc]], [[Jake One]], [[MGK]] |website= }} In addition to his wrestling career, Cena is a rapper. He performed his fifth WWE [[Music in professional wrestling|theme song]], "Basic Thuganomics", and it was featured on the WWE soundtrack album ''[[WWE Originals]]''. He also recorded a song, "Untouchables", for the company's next soundtrack album ''[[WWE ThemeAddict: The Music, Vol. 6]]''. He collaborated on a remix for the song [[Murs 3:16: The 9th Edition|"H-U-S-T-L-E"]] along with [[Murs (rapper)|Murs]], [[E-40]], and [[Chingo Bling]].{{cite web|url=http://www.emusic.com/album/10851/10851182.html?fref=150051|title=H-U-S-T-L-E, MP3 Album page|accessdate=May 17, 2007|publisher=[[eMusic]]|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070926230043/http://www.emusic.com/album/10851/10851182.html?fref=150051|archivedate=September 26, 2007|deadurl=yes}} Cena's debut album, ''[[You Can't See Me]]'', was recorded with his cousin [[Tha Trademarc]]. It features, amongst other songs, his entrance theme, "[[The Time Is Now (John Cena song)|The Time is Now]]", and the single "Bad, Bad Man", for which a music video was made that parodied 1980s culture, including the television show ''[[The A-Team]]''. A video was also made for the second single, "Right Now," and premiered on the August 8 ''Raw''. Cena and Tha Trademarc were later featured on a track by [[The Perceptionists]] named "Champion Scratch". Cena appeared on [[Tionne "T-Boz" Watkins]]' album ''[[Still Cool]]''.{{cite web|url=http://www.undergroundhiphop.com/store/detail.asp?UPC=DJX11212|title=Perceptionists – 'Black Dialogue/ 5 O'Clock/ Champion Scratch'|accessdate=May 17, 2007|publisher=UndergroundHiipHop.com|quote='Champion Scratch' feat. WWE Superstar John Cena as a bonus cut!}} In October 2014, Cena was featured on two songs with rapper [[Wiz Khalifa]] for his two singles "All Day" and "Breaks" for the soundtrack to the ''[[WWE 2K15]]'' video game.{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/6281570/john-cena-wiz-khalifa-twwe-video-game-soundtrack|title=John Cena & Wiz Khalifa Team Up on 'WWE 2K15' Video Game Soundtrack}} == Other ventures == === Endorsements === [[File:CENATION3-T4.jpg|thumb|Cena signing merchandise for a young fan]] Before his [[professional wrestling]] career, Cena appeared in an advertisement for [[Gold's Gym]]. As a wrestler, he has endorsed the [[energy drink]] YJ Stinger,{{cite episode|title=November 23, 2003|series=WWE Confidential|serieslink=WWE Confidential|network=[[USA Network]]}} appearing in commercials beginning in October 2003, and [[Subway (restaurant)|Subway]],{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/inside/news/cenasubway2|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20061207162217/http://www.wwe.com/inside/news/cenasubway2|archivedate=December 7, 2006|title=Cena to 'Eat Fresh' with Jared Fogle|accessdate=January 13, 2007|publisher=WWE}} for whom he filmed advertisements with their spokesperson [[Jared Fogle]] in November 2006 that began airing the next January. For a time in 2007, he also endorsed two "signature collections" of energy drinks and [[energy bar]]s sold by American Body Builders.{{cite web|url=http://www.americanbodybuilding.com/v1/cenapack/|title=Cena Pak product page|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070328183219/http://www.americanbodybuilding.com/v1/cenapack/|archivedate=March 28, 2007|accessdate=November 28, 2007|publisher=American Body Builders}} In 2008, Cena filmed a commercial as part of [[Global Gillette|Gillette's]] "Young Guns" [[NASCAR]] campaign.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/inside/overtheropes/news/cenayoungguns|publisher=WWE|date=February 12, 2008|title=Cena gets in the ring with NASCAR's hottest drivers|accessdate=February 25, 2009}} In 2009, Cena expanded his relationship with Gillette by introducing a new online campaign called "Be A Superstar" featuring himself alongside fellow WWE wrestlers Chris Jericho and Cody Rhodes. The campaign features [[motivation]]al videos.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/beasuperstar|publisher=WWE|date=July 13, 2009|title=WWE "Be A Superstar" featuring John Cena in "Stepping Up"|accessdate=July 13, 2009|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090625201140/http://beasuperstar.wwe.com/|archivedate=June 25, 2009}} After [[Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson]] called Cena "[[Fruity Pebbles]]" during their feud (in reference to Cena's colorful merchandise) Cena appeared on the box of Fruity Pebbles cereal in 2013.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/classics/the-rock-15-rare-raw-moments |title=The Rock's 15 rare Raw moments|date=July 16, 2012|first=Zach|last=Linder|quote=The Rock has had many memorable moments on Raw, including identifying John Cena as a bowl of Fruity Pebbles}}{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/classics/the-rock-rare-raw-moments-photos|title=The Rock's rare Raw moments: photos|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120722002201/http://www.wwe.com/classics/the-rock-rare-raw-moments-photos|archive-date=July 22, 2012|access-date=November 27, 2015|quote=You might know about The Great One calling John Cena a bowl of Fruity Pebbles}}{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/inside/overtheropes/john-cena-replaces-fred-flintstone-on-the-cover-of-post-pebbles-cereal-26082141|author=WWE Staff|date=January 8, 2013|title=John Cena replaces Fred Flintstone on the cover of Post Pebbles cereal|quote=The Rock saddled Cena with the nickname "Fruity Pebbles" due to his bright-colored assortment of T-shirts.}} On October 13, 2016, Cena made his debut as the voice of Ernie the Elephant in a new commercial campaign launched by Wonderful Pistachios. He was named to ''Adweek's'' "Creative 100" and received praise for the performance.{{cite web|URL=http://www.adweek.com/adfreak/john-cena-not-elephant-now-hes-playing-one-tv-wonderful-pistachios-173969|title=John Cena's not an Elephant, but now he's playing one on TV for Wonderful Pistachios|accessdate=January 14, 2017|website=adweek.com|author=David Gianastasio|date=October 10, 2016}} === Philanthropy === [[File:CENATION2-T4.jpg|thumb|Cena posing with children]] Cena has granted over 500 wishes for children with life-threatening illnesses through the [[Make-A-Wish Foundation]]; the most in Make-A-Wish history.{{cite web|url=http://www.espn.com/espn/story/_/id/13480710/wwe-star-john-cena-grant-milestone-500th-make-wish-request|title=WWE star Cena to hit Make-A-Wish milestone|publisher=|accessdate=December 30, 2016}} In 2009, Cena received the Chris Greicius Celebrity Award.{{cite web|url=http://www.wish.org/news/news_releases/2009_cg_awards|title=Make-A-Wish Foundation: News & Events: News Releases|publisher=Wish.org|date=September 14, 2009|accessdate=March 28, 2011}} From late 2011 until [[WrestleMania XXVIII]], Cena wore a black "Rise Above Hate" T-shirt promoting WWE's "Be a Star" anti-[[bullying]] campaign. In September and October 2012, Cena wore pink and black with the phrase "Rise Above Cancer" in partnership with [[Susan G. Komen for the Cure]] as part of [[Breast Cancer Awareness Month]]. In November 2016 Cena appeared in a public service announcement, "We Are America", sponsored by the [[Ad Council]] as part of its "Love Has No Labels" campaign.[[Ad Council]], [http://lovehasnolabels.com/social-gallery Love Has No Labels] "We Are America". == In popular culture == {{Main|Unexpected John Cena}} In mid-2015, Cena was the subject of the [[Internet meme]] "Unexpected John Cena", also known as simply "Unexpected Cena" or "It's John Cena".{{cite web|last=Feldman|first=Brian|date=December 18, 2015|url=http://nymag.com/following/2015/12/famous-man-responds-to-meme-its-john-cena.html#|title=A Famous Man Responded to a Meme Involving Him — IT'S JOHN CENA|work=[[New York (magazine)|New York]]|accessdate=March 5, 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160122132356/http://nymag.com/following/2015/12/famous-man-responds-to-meme-its-john-cena.html|archivedate=January 22, 2016|df=mdy-all}} == Personal life == [[File:John Cena and Nikki Bella at SXSW Red Carpet premiere of BLOCKERS (26876910238).jpg|thumb|upright|Cena with then-fiancée [[Nikki Bella]] in March 2018]] Cena resides in [[Tampa, Florida]].{{cite news|url=https://www.usatoday.com/life/movies/news/2006-10-08-cena-carlson_x.htm|title=A new action star/femme fatale pairing?|accessdate=March 27, 2007|last=Keck|first=William|work=USA Today|quote=At his Tampa home, Cena maintains a humidor that holds more than 300 cigars.|date=October 8, 2006}} While promoting his 2009 film ''[[12 Rounds (film)|12 Rounds]]'', Cena announced his engagement to Elizabeth Huberdeau.{{cite news|first=Jim|last=Moore|url=http://www.seattlepi.com/moore/400249_moore16.html|title=Cena works hard on his rags to riches story|accessdate=February 16, 2009|date=February 16, 2009|work=[[Seattle Post-Intelligencer]]}}{{cite news|title=Cena, WWE score knockout in 12 Rounds|last=Varsallone|first=Jim|date=March 23, 2009|work=[[The Miami Herald]]|page=3}} They were married on July 11, 2009. On May 1, 2012, Cena filed for divorce,{{cite web|title=Petition for Dissolution of Marriage|url=http://blogs.herald.com/files/petitionfordissolutionofmarriage-1.pdf|publisher=''[[The Miami Herald]]''|accessdate=June 20, 2012|format=PDF}} which was finalized on July 18.{{cite web|last=Vultaggio|first=Maria|title=John Cena And Elizabeth Huberdeau Settle Divorce War: WWE Wrestler Makes Peace With Estranged Wife|url=http://www.ibtimes.com/john-cena-and-elizabeth-huberdeau-settle-divorce-war-wwe-wrestler-makes-peace-estranged-wife-726833|work=International Business Times|accessdate=December 1, 2012}} The divorce was mentioned on-screen during Cena's feud with [[Dwayne Johnson|The Rock]] as part of their rematch at [[WrestleMania 29]].{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} In 2012, he began dating fellow wrestler [[Nikki Bella]]. They became engaged when Cena proposed to her at [[WrestleMania 33]] on April 2, 2017, but ended their relationship in April 2018.{{cite web|last=Longeretta|first=Emily|url=https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/nikki-bella-and-john-cena-break-up-end-engagement/|title=Nikki Bella and John Cena Break Up After 6 Years Together, End Engagement|date=April 15, 2018|accessdate=April 18, 2018|work=[[Us Weekly]]|publisher=[[American Media, Inc.]]}} They were scheduled to marry on May 5, 2018.{{Cite news|url=http://people.com/tv/john-cena-nikki-bella-split-wedding-date/|title=John Cena & Nikki Bella: Inside Their Canceled Nuptials on What Would Have Been Their Wedding Day|work=PEOPLE.com|access-date=2018-05-10|language=en}} Cena is a fan of Japanese [[anime]] and has named ''[[Fist of the North Star (1986 film)|Fist of the North Star]]'' as his favorite anime movie.{{cite news|url=http://www.mensfitness.com/sports_and_recreation/athletes/132|title=12 Rounds with John Cena|date=March 19, 2009|work=[[Men's Fitness]]|accessdate=April 10, 2009}}{{Citation|last=GQ|title=John Cena Goes Undercover on Twitter, YouTube, and Reddit {{!}} Actually Me {{!}} GQ|date=2017-07-10|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L-wZlsLZ0AE|accessdate=2017-07-22}} He also plays video games, citing the ''[[Command & Conquer]]'' series as his favorite.{{cite web|url=http://www.ugo.com/channels/sports/features/wrestling/?page=John%20Cena%20Interview%20&cur=John-Cena |title=John Cena interview |accessdate=May 11, 2007 |publisher=[[UGO]] |quote=''Command & Conquer'' is what I'm all about," [Cena] says, and he plays all the time...
